description:
I think you might be the best lasagna in the city. I'm not Garfield but, I've eaten my share. 

The pasta is the perfect thinness and texture. The mushrooms are perfectly tender, never rubbery. The cheese is always in balance, not too much or too little. The sauce so fresh. The salad so fresh too. 

I could not find something bad to say if I tried! Makes for a very short review, eh? 

I miei migliori auguri con tanto affetto.

The hours though? I do wish they were longer.
author: Liss T.

description:
I passed by Marcella's when I first moved to the Dogpatch a few months ago, but saw that they had limited hours during lunch. After doing some Yelp searches and investigating, I determined that I would swing by for lunch the next time I was able to work from home or come home early. 

A month ago, I was able to make the times work and swung by for some take out. I got a lasagna for my boyfriend and a spaghetti carbonara for myself. I had my spaghetti less than 10 min after walking out their doors and saved the lasagna for my boyfriend for dinner. Wow. I was totally blown away. The noodles had a great texture and the sauce was rich and flavorful, without being too greasy. Boyfriend had the lasagna later that night and agreed that it was great. 

I'll definitely be back the next time I'm home during the day - great atmosphere, friendly people and amazing food!
author: Ada C.

description:
My Boss, Ysiad LOOOOVESSS this place!! We gave him a party at my job, and we purchased about 10 lasagnas for the staff. So you know we're in SFO, so everyone is gluten-free, sugar-free, fat-free, dairy-free, nut free, grain-free, faux meat, keto dietish, basically a water and ice cube diet. So I run into the party and see that we had all meatless lasagnas, and I was skeptical but packed a doggy bag of truffle and mushroom lasagne. So walking back to the BART I started eating it. Y'ALLLLL OMG! Like I want them to cater my wedding, baby shower, divorce party, funeral, the whole shit!! 

People......in all honestly, I was eating, singing, and twerking at the same time on the way to the BART. Eating this lasagna caused the skies opened up, it turned sunny, homeless folks got housing, the ghetto pigeons stood in place, all of the honking stopped, all of the stoplights turned green..

Eating Marcellas is like having the winning lotto numbers. I'm definitely not mature to have one nearby my house, because it would be my new gym... or church.

From the bottom of my heart, THANK YOU someones nonna who created that angelic recipe that gathered my whole entire existence.
author: Nickey H.

description: Just make sure they're open for a meal, or get there early and take home a full lasagna. Now stop reading and don't miss this place. Best lasagna I've ever had, and likely will ever have. Sorry mom...
author: Bryce B.

description:
On my way to work today, I was listening to another installment of Star 101's Second Date Update on. A lady called in because her date hasn't been responsive after their first lunch date. She thought they had a great date but he has only responded to her texts with emojis. 

The hosts call the guy up and he said, he would never go on a date with her again. Apparently, she had one too many margaritas (he lost count after three) and she became sloppy - slurring her words and spitting on him. She even did kickboxing AND karate outside the restaurant on Burlingame Avenue!

DAAAAMN GUURRRL, you sure know how to party...and it's only 1 pm! Hmmm, what happens at midnight?! 

Well, if they went to Marcella's Lasagneria for their lunch date, there wouldn't have been any drunken shenanigans and perhaps even a second date! 

Marcella's Lasagneria is a cute, old skool Italian eatery (café-sized) serving a myriad of housemade lasagnas and pastas. Both are available by the tray with a 24 hour advanced order. No hard liquor so there's no chance of getting sloppy. 

They also bottle their own sauces and aiolis that are available for purchase.

The only drawback is their very limited hours. They're only open on the weekdays from 11:30 am - 4:30 pm so it's taken me 6 years to finally pay a visit. 

(Per their website, the full menu is available until 3:30 pm, then it's pick-up/to-go for lasagna only until 4:30 pm.) 

To my surprise, it's pretty much full service expect you pay at the counter when you're done eating. 

Everything sounded great on the menu but I knew it would be a long time before I could return so for my first time, the son of the owner recommended the Abruzzo Lasagna w/ housemade Italian sausage, spicy tomato sauce ($14.50): https://bit.ly/2joX3Jm which comes with a side salad. 

The lasagna they serve here is unique, it's six very thin layers of noodles with melty cheese, béchamel, and your choice of filling (sausage, mushrooms, eggplant, bolognese, butternut squash, etc). 

My Abruzzo lasagna arrived bubbling hot with crisp, caramelized edges of cheese which I enjoy. There was a good ratio of melty cheese, sausage crumbles, and robust tomato sauce (wasn't spicy). However, because the noodles are thin, they're very soft. I like my noodles with a bite. Nonetheless, it was a very satisfying meal and I took the leftovers home to enjoy for dinner. 

The father-son owners are super warm and friendly. The lasagna took over 15 minutes to warm up so do say, yes (!) to the complimentary bread accompanied with olive oil and balsamic vinegar for dipping.

Very casual atmosphere with a handful of tables inside. The dog-friendly outdoor seating is quaint and is perfect for a lunch date.   
 
I can see why Marcella's Lasagneria is a neighborhood favorite - warm service, good lasagnas, and reasonably priced. I must return to try their ravioli with black truffle sauce - I just hope it doesn't take me another 6 years.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
My first meal of many in Dogpatch was at Marcella's Lasagneria and it was incredible! Though a bit pricy, I would definitely say the lasagna here is worth it. The service was great and the place was very quiet. The bread with balsamic was fresh and delicious. 

Next time I'll try the butternut squash lasagna, but this time around I got the classic bolognese. The portion was perfect (especially since I waited till 3 to eat lunch). Will definitely be coming back soon!
author: Manuela R.

description:
I loved how casual and unassuming this spot was. The use really cutlery but food comes on paper plates. The folks who run this spot are really Italian and it shows in how the food is prepared. 

My had had the special giant rigatoni with speck. It was supposed to be in a wine sauce with saffron but seem more like just olive oil. She did enjoy it. She loved the tomato lentil soup. 

I got the eggplant lasagna and it was very good. I'm not eating much cheese any longer but this was worth eating cheese for. I would happily return to try the other varieties.
author: Marco M.

description:
Oh my god. I've had this place bookmarked on yelp for about 3 years and could never quite make the time to get there when they're open- until this week. 

I made a point to go this week for lunch and it was simply the best pasta I've ever had. Period. The service is amazing and super friendly and I craving more pasta as I type this.
author: Leina K.

description: Had the Bolognese lasagna. Delicious! Comes with a nice small salad which was good. The bread here is delicious. Service is awesome. Will def come again.
author: c L.

description: I've been to this place several times - it's one of my favorites in SF. You can't go wrong when you choose any of the lasagnas. Last time I had lasagna bianca (white sauce) and it was amazing. Don't forget to order the antipasto which comes with real mozzarella and truffle. The pasta with truffle sauce is also delicious. The owners are very nice people and the place is very welcoming.
author: Andrey V.

description: Holy Shit! I had to interrupt my lunch to deliver this timely communication. Got a to go order of the Vurdura lasagna. Delicately constructed with pesto, sun dried tomatoes and topped with zucchini. This is some of the best lasagna in SF. Bold flavors and thin, warm soft pieces of lasagna cooked perfectly. Come here for the old world taste
author: Johny B.

description: Such a friendly welcoming family working there. They really care about the food. Had the Abruzzo  sausage lasagna and husband had the mushroom creamy red sauce one, we shared. Homemake Sausage was in delicious red sauce and was lightly spicy. Homemade lasagna noodle was the thinnest best layered I ever had! Loved it all.
author: alexia h.

description: I loved the lasagna here! I got the Bolognese and it was deeeeeeeelicious! My manager got the alle Vongole with Fettucine and it didn't come in the white wine sauce it seems? It was just sitting in a pool of oil :( so there's that. But the lasagna was really good!
author: Michael K.

description:
BEST LASAGNA EVER!!!

I came all the way from San Diego for this lasagna and I was blown away. The flavor, texture, and smell was all there. I went there twice during the same weekend. I give the verdure lasagne 10/10!
author: Isabel J.

description:
Storytime: I first came here back in January. I was on a college trip from Boston and had a very carefully planned itinerary (a group of us were in the Bay area to tour tech companies/startups and such) so we ended up in Dogpatch for one visit. I was looking for a place to get lunch and it was during an absolute downpour. Yelp seemed to like this place, so I figured I'd give it a try, and boy am I glad I did. First of all, they immediately sat me and were incredibly nice, which was very comforting being by myself and coming in from the rain. I was pretty hungry so I ordered the Caprese salad and the Ravioli al Tartufo. 

Caprese - The ingredients were clearly very fresh, and having the greens tossed in EVOO was great - I'm personally not a huge fan of balsamic with Caprese so it was a nice touch, along with the oregano on the mozzarella.
Ravioli - I tried so hard not to inhale it and savor it as much as I could because it was SO GOOD and extremely comforting on a cool, rainy day. The pasta itself was wonderful and the black truffle sauce was amazing with it. **Pro tip** if you get bread, use it to soak up any leftover sauce after you finish the pasta. 

Everything I had here was fantastic - even the bread! Also, the owners were so genuinely nice and took care of me very attentively. But the craziest part of all this? I just came back here again about a month ago and ordered the same thing, and they remembered me from my order! It had been 9 MONTHS since I first went there and they still remembered me. Amazing.

TL;DR it may not be fancy, but the ingredients are fresh, the food is perfectly prepared, and the people are wonderful. A winning combination as far as I'm concerned.
author: Celia T.

description:
What a gem! This is a small shop owned by a son and his father and they were so kind. When we were seated, they treated us like family and made sure we felt comfortable and introduced us to all our foods.

The food was phenomenal. I ordered a truffle ravioli and my boyfriend ordered the mushroom lasagna. Both were so impressive. I only wish there were more of it. I even took the bread and soaked up all the truffle sauce from my ravioli because it was so tasty.

I wish this place were open later on weekdays and on weekends because I usually only visit SF on the weekends. But I suppose that's what makes this lasagneria so much more special :)
author: Angela W.

description:
Lasagna - A
Carbonara - C
Service - B+ 

I've had takeout from this place before and it was delicious. Probably because we heated up the lasagna and that was all we ordered. Piping hot at home and delicious if you broil the top a bit for that crusty cheesy goodness. Eating there prob would have been better if we only ordered the lasagna. Carbonara was too creamy and heavy. Sadly we got tired of eating the Carbonara. 

Recommendation: order the lasagna to take home and it will prob be the best lasagna you'll have...
author: Marlene T.

description:
The owners are so nice!  The dad and son treat you like family greetings you with a handshake and probably even a hug!  The lasagne is the best!  It's like a legit home cooked Italian meal.  However it is only open during the lunch hour and if it's a nice day, they have outdoor seating.

Also, the food is served on paper plates... which is kind of frugal, but really isn't a deal breaker because it's so good!

And the free bread could use some work, but can't complain too much when it's free!
author: Nyla K.

description:
BEWARE!!!
They are not open when Yelp or even their own sign on the counter says they are. Do not trust them and come over during those hours. After a 20 minute drive and excited that we finally get to try this place (because I'm usually working during their odd hours) we arrived to find them closed at 1pm on a Thursday. Yes, it is during the week between Christmas and New Year's, and they are a small business. But there is NOTHING on the window saying they'll be closed during by heir normal hours during this week. I really try to support local businesses but why make it so hard??? I am trying to give you my money! 
Very disappointing.
author: Griffen H.

description: Some of the best lasagna I've ever had. Yes it's pricey and your not earning any diet points eating these lasagna's but they are incredible, creative and worth every penny. Truly a hidden gem, I pick up a pan whenever I'm having guests over. Only downside is their limited hours but it's worth fitting into your schedule.
author: Orange M.

description: I love this place with my heart and belly!! The guys here are so sweet and the food is just amazing. As my dining bud had heard, everything is served on compostable plates, with real silverware. Bread and oil comes to all tables and it is tiny so come early or come small or do takeout. I'll be coming back here multiple times.
author: Catherine R.

description: I have always loved the mushroom lasagne...this time we had the spaghetti carbonara and the special of the day with Branzino.  Excellent!
author: Geri S.

description:
So sad this place is only open weekdays from 11.30am to 3.30pm as I live & work on the Peninsula!   Was able to go for lunch with co-workers and though I was skeptical as I'm not a lasagna person, this is the real deal.   Four of us shared:

* Truffle ravioli:  My favorite of the bunch, but I love truffles.  Deep rich flavor, super creamy and truffle-y sauce.  5/5

* Bolognese lasagna:  I got an end portion and so my piece was likely drier and had less filling than my coworkers, as this was my least favorite but a couple of them said it was their most favorite.  2/5

* Mushroom lasagna:  The mushroom flavor wasn't as strong as I liked but the overall creaminess was a plus.  4/5

* Bianca lasagna:  Lovely rich bechamel and cheese sauce with mild hints of pancetta.  More pancetta would make it perfect but this was still wonderful.  4.5/5

Service was a bit rude and slow -- our waiter (seems to be the owner) didn't tell us any specials and gave us grief for our party not all arriving at the same time, even though there were plenty of open tables.  If I'm in SF early after work, I'll try to drop by as it's open until 6pm for takeout.   Highly recommended!
author: Alice C.

description: Go here. You're an idiot to let this SF gem pass you by! I ordered for a dinner party and had a task rabbit pick up for me. Best decision I ever made and everyone wanted to know my recipe!!
author: Amy P.

description:
Visited 5/12/17 
(near closing time)

WOW! I am not a lasagna person- I've never really liked it and would definitely not go out of my way to get it, but Marcella's Lasagneria changed my opinion on lasagna completely. 

I ordered the:
1. ABRUZZO lasagna (w/spicy Italian sausage)- This lasagna was really good. It wasn't too spicy and the sweetness from the carrot really balanced it out. 
2. BOLOGNESE (w/ beef sauce)- This was my personal favorite! The flavors were very well balanced and reminiscent of a traditional lasagna without the awful texture from Ricotta cheese. I loved that there weren't too many textures going on but it wasn't completely mush either. I would definitely recommend this. 
*I took the Bolognese lasagna home to reheat the following day and it was equally as delicious! 

I would really like to return and try some of the other items on the menu, which all sounded really good. Their exceptional service and friendliness along with food that could draw people from miles away makes it a restaurant that I would recommend to anyone without reservation!
author: Katherine C.

description: This place was amazing. Me and the boys decided to treat ourselves for lunch and my pal recommended this spot. I was having some heartburn going in and I told them I was only gonna get a salad, but that menu was too tempting. I got some amazing ravioli and bread to soak up all the sauce afterwards. Screw you heartburn! But the one thing that stood out was the hospitality. The dark haired gent that served us was so friggin genuine and chill that I'm 100% going back and asking for him. Both my friends are now talking about the next time they go, because they're so eager to try new things on the menu and I'm so down to join them.
author: Rudy B.

description:
10/10

- I don't think you can find lasagna much better than this in the states
- make sure they're open before you make the trip
- yelp elites bitching about paper plates and insignificant details
- this place serves authentic Italian food so if you're disappointed by the lack of spaghetti and meatballs please don't channel your ignorance towards negative yelp reviews
author: Yuen Hsi C.

description:
My friend had suggested this place and I loved it. 

I went to the location right before closing and they were so welcoming. I love the service and the food. 

Bolognese. Always.
author: Nina Y.

description:
My friend took me out to lunch after a session at Dogpatch Boulders but didn't tell me that we were going to eat LASAGNA. Normally, I absolutely despise lasagna, but I figured it was time to give it a try again. Omg I'm SO glad I was open to coming to Marcella's. This is what I imagined good lasagna would taste like, and now I can never go back to eating basic Italian food again.

First of all, the service here is incredible. All of the waiters and waitresses go above and beyond to make sure you feel welcome like family in their own home. My friend and I were seated outside. I ordered the Mushroom Lasagna, and my friend ordered the Butternut Lasagna, which I thought sounded a little strange at first.

I was absolutely blown away by the quality of food. Both dishes. The pasta itself was freshly made, not mushy like it tastes at other restaurants, and there is an excellent ratio of pasta to vegetables. Once you're done eating, you can take your time before going inside the restaurant to pay. I'll need to come back to try some of their other dishes, because everything that other guests were eating looked scrumptious. I'm very impressed by this place and will definitely be bringing other friends here in the future!
author: Stefanie C.

description: This place had the worst service I seen anywhere in my entire life. I went here because I was in the area and wanted a quite place to have lunch while I made an important call, but from the moment I walked in, everything went down hill. The place was completely empty and when I tried to explain to the waiter that I just wanted a light dish to eat while I made an important call, he started hassling me about my lunch choice. Moments later the owner joined in and they both continued to question me about my choice of having a soup. When I finally got my soup and started my call the place became a little bit louder and I stepped out to sit on a table outside. Moments later the owner/cook came out and the owner began yelling at me and telling me to either go back inside or leave and go "find a Starbucks", without any consideration of the fact that I was on the phone and I had explained to them that I was taking an important call. This was by far the worst treatment I would expect from a local "moms and pops" restaurant. Definitely not going back and wouldn't recommended to anyone. It's a shame that I didn't have a chance to enjoy my lunch.
author: Guillermo L.

description:
Our party of 8 was seated upstairs in what felt like a private dining area reserved especially for us (we did in fact make lunch reservations). Our waiter detailed the specials and even brought with him the fresh spinach infused pasta he had made that morning which would serve as the foundation of the entree.

The food was authentic and the atmosphere remained jovial with the insightful and enthusiastic input of our waiter. Not only will you enjoy an incredible, authentic pasta dish at Marcella's but the the genuine pride these folks have in their cooking will keep you coming back again and again.
author: Will F.

description: Did you know lasagnerias were a thing? Well they are and this one is specifically the best. Run by father/son duo Massimo and Gianfranco, Marcella's serves life-changing lasagna. This isn't the Americanized stuff filled with cottage cheese. It's thin sheets of homemade pasta carefully layered with the best ingredients. They are also the kindest, most hospitable people ever. They only serve seated lunch, but you can get takeout after lunch hour. Makes a delicious dinner. Catering is incredible too!
author: Annie T.

description:
Admittedly, this lasagna is the main reason I created this Yelp account. This is the best lasagna I have ever eaten. Period. 

I have been here countless times. Each experience is equal to the last (I hate when people say better than the last, it detracts from all the other times they have gone). 

That is the first question I asked myself as I entered this modest Father/Son Italian eatery was a simple one: What is a "Lasagneria"? 

Knowing the answer to this question is completely irrelevant. 

There is no point in trying to find another "Lasagneria". This is the one. The only one. Marcella's wins. If you've eaten here you no longer need to search for any other lasagna anywhere ever. You want to google Lasagneria? 

I will save you some time. Your search will return Marcella's. And it isn't because other Lasagnerias don't exist. I am sure they do. It is because no other Lasagnerias in the area are relevant. 

A day may come when you think to yourself, "What about that fun family Italian joint down the road?"

Forget it. 

Or maybe you will think, "How about that fancy Italian restaurant with a bunch of Michelin stars?" 

Nope. Wrong. The correct answer was go straight to Marcella's Lasagneria. This lasagna will blow you away. 

Okay. Breathe. Now to pair that with some evidence. 

Service: Every time I come into Marcella's, I feel at home. G and Massimo treat every customer with care and respect. G often works the front end of the restaurant with other excellent servers like Rory. All of them are speedy, thoughtful, polite, and have a sense of humor. If you'd like to sit quietly in the back and shovel food into your mouth - you can. But I'd recommend striking up some conversation. 

Ambience: It's a Father/Son Italian eatery in the Dogpatch. It isn't Saison, but it has a uniquely charming atmosphere. You feel like you've been transported out of the normal SF hustle and bustle straight to an Italian eatery in Florence. Or maybe not. I haven't been to Italy so I wouldn't actually know. 

Food: 

I will review my personal favorite: The Bianca Lasagna

Let's begin with the thinly prepared sheets of hand-crafted semolina pasta. Each pasta sheet is delicate, and about as thick as cardstock. The pasta is layered among creamy Bechamel sauce, pancetta, and a variety of herbs and possibly spices. The bottom sheet of pasta coalesces and crisps up with the cheese and pancetta creating a chewy and delicious foundation to the perfect slice of lasagna. 

As you work you way through the block of fresh pasta, melted cheese, pancetta, and love, you may begin to question your morals. Should you take out the person next to you so you can eat whatever they ordered? Don't do it. That is murder and is extremely wrong and illegal. Instead, you should call over the waiter or waitress and order a tray to go. I have shamefully done that before. Except when I called, I pretended there was a party that night so G and Massimo wouldn't know the entire thing wasn't only me and pass silent, but visible judgement. 

Anyway, all their ingredients are incredibly fresh and delicious. This is arguably the best food I have eaten at this price point. Roughly $15-18 for the meal of dreams.

My only qualm is that they are not open on weekends. But that won't stop me and it shouldn't stop you. Just go there between 11:30am and 3:30pm on a weekday. Take a long lunch. Skip work and go here. Whatever. Just figure your life out and go eat at Marcella's. You will not regret it.
author: Evan R.

description: Probably the best place to get lasagna. Period. The food is always piping hot and I adore the family that operates this place. I always end up ordering the mushroom lasagna, and I'm never disappointed.
author: Vasu S.

description:
I read about this place and bookmarked it years ago but only recently found myself in the dog patch during their serving time, which is limited; mid day during the work week. And I've already returned several times.

Marcella's lasagnas with a variety of fillings and sauces are oh so memorable and delicious! Their thin ribbon-like noodles delight this pasta lover and every sauce is excellent but my favorites are the Bolognese, Abruzza and Bianca. If there is such a thing as a balanced lasagna this is it, pasta, sauce, meat, and cheese with a delightfully chewy bottom layer.  $11.95 for a large square served on a paper plate. Be patient because they don't use a microwave to warm the lasagna or anything else on their menu. 

While I always dine there (inside or outside), I also leave with another slice or two for home because the lasagna warms up nicely (400 degrees for 10-12 min).
author: Sonya B.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for forever, but the hours never quite aligned with my schedule, but they changed their schedule so that on the days I commute to work on the peninsula, I can get off at the 22nd st station pop in here just in time to pick up some lasagna before it closes. 

The day I discovered the change to the closing time, I stopped in and I chatted with the manager for a bit and he shared some recommendations. I got the Abruzzo and the mushroom + some minestrone soup. The manager recommended that I warm the lasagna up in the oven (which works for me cuz I don't have a microwave) and he also told me that if I ever saw a soup special that I wanted to try that was only available during lunch service, I could call him up and order for pick up later that day. So definitely an A+ for service. Also, it was clear that this guy was committed to quality and took pride in his work. 

Then I got home, warmed up the lasagna for me and my boyfriend and OMFG!!! That lasagna was like putting little clouds of lasagna in my mouth. It was sooooo good. 

I'm trying to lay off the carbs, but I'm  typing this as I'm on the train home and it's going to take all the willpower that I have to not pop in there when I get off the train.
author: Alison H.

description:
Lasagna is top notch. Very delicate pasta with bold fresh ingredients that shine. What really blew my mind here though was the ravioli.  It's really hard to find a ravioli that has the perfect balance of filling to pasta ratio but they pull it off.. and the filling.. absolutley perfect texture.. creamy yet velvety and light. Transported me back to grandma's kitchen.
 BELLISSIMO!
author: Raphael P.

description:
The first time I tried Marcella's lasagna I had the abruzzo and bolognese at a company lunch.  It was so impressive that a few weeks later, I just HAD to throw a lasagna party as an excuse to spend $62 per lasagna to try different flavors and traveled all the way to the City to do so...and I NEVER order lasagna when I eat out.  That's how good it was.

Food: Ordered a pan of mushroom, bolognese, and verdure lasagnas.  All were amazing, but there was something extra special about the mushroom.  All had layers and layers of homemade pasta sheets and although they had all those layers, the lasagna was still light and not heavy like you just ate a brick.  I will definitely be back for the mushroom lasagna...so amaze balls.

Service: While I didn't pick it up myself, the first thing I was told was how nice the employees were...not just nice, but super nice.

Interior: small and quaint.

Miles traveled to get here were 25, and to the City? Took forever, but so worth it and would do it again in a heartbeat.  You have to make killer lasagna to have "lasagneria" in your restaurant's name and these guys did not disappoint.
author: M. H.

description:
This lasagna CHANGED MY LIFE. I didn't even know you could cook it like this! The guy running the place is super cool and friendly and knowledgeable as well.

We got the sausage and the mushroom. We were served the wrong ones initially, but it was so good we didn't want to switch back. Once we did, the other flavor was just as amazing. I've been thinking about it ever since and that was three weeks ago HOWEVER...

I haven't been back since and I'll tell you why: they are only open for lunch, and I'm never in that part of town during that time. I've actually been wanting to eat there for years but just never can make it over there during that time. Now that I know what it tastes like though, I'm going to make time in my schedule just to go.
author: Anthony L.

description:
i am. in love. with. this place.

went on a friday just a little before noon for my bestfriend's birthday lunch (this wasn't any old lunch; my hopes were high). sun was shining, it was a picturesque day in dogpatch. we were seated at a super sweet table for two inside.

it's a modest spot: some outdoor seating, a cafe-sized first floor, and an upstairs dining room (which i didn't see) for larger parties.

our hosts were excellent to us in every way: attentive, warm/friendly, and, best of all, you can tell they love food and believe in what they're serving.

we ordered the bianco lasagna and the daily special (the chef had showed us the pasta he had made fresh and would be using that day. we were told he could make it with any sauce we chose but we asked for his recommendation).

after ordering, we were immediately given bread (presumably made in-house) and some sort of olive oil mixture to dip it (so tasty!). the food came out quickly, and on paper plates, which i enjoyed. **i have been looking for an italian spot with a more casual ambiance like this one**

bianco lasagna-- everything i dreamed. if you like your onions PRESENT in your food-- get this. this wasn't your usual lasagna-- its 6 layers of thinner pasta compared to the usual 2-3 thicker/wavy types i've had before. 

the special-- it was a bolognese type meat sauce with the fresh pasta and it was just delicious. what else can i say?? the flavors: on point. texture: on point. serving size: on point.

towards the end of the meal, i ordered an espresso (lavazza!) and informed our server that it was my friend's birthday-- he assured me, "i'll see what i can do" and went to the back. shortly after, he came out with a slice of spumoni ice cream cake that was just the perfect end note to an already wonderful meal/experience.

somewhere in the middle of the meal, i was already planning my next visit. by the end, i decided that i want to be a regular here. i'll be back!
author: Jhoana Rose J.

description: The lasagna has no flaws whatsoever. The service is wonderful and personable, extremely inviting and casual. Great prices, pleasant and friendly staff.
author: Wade M.

description: Almost a once a week endeavor.  The specials change all the time and are great.  This is a very different lasagna....paper thin noodles.  Homemade everything.   There's a difference being family owned and family owned with care. This is a proud family owned business that actually takes no shortcuts.  The dad and son are friendly as is the staff.  Take note crappy Italian in the bay area.
author: A A.

description:
This is the best lasagna I've ever had, and I'm a lasagna lover. They have different varieties every day, and but I just stick with my favorite and split the daily special with my friend.

The owners are ridiculously friendly, I honestly feel like when I'm there, I'm family.

They also serve trays and they're amazing when you put one in the oven.

Do yourself a favor and eat here ASAP
author: Wahid S.

description:
They have really good lasagna, about five types of it and it seems really authentic, like homemade pasta and the right ingredients. Only open on weekdays Monday-Friday 11:30 am to 4:30 and ***3:30 to 5:00  Pick up/To Go only*** so basically you can't go there at all if you live in the Dogpatch and work during the week. You can call ahead for pickup.

You can also get a combo with bread, salad, and a soda drink, but it's like $14.50 and not necessarily worth it, and once they forgot the soda so that was disappointing. The atmosphere indoors and outdoors (umbrella table seating) seems pretty Italian (looks and feels like it).  Wish it was open on the weekend, but right now the best thing to do is get take out of the Abruzzio (I've also tried the eggplant and the Bolognese) and take it up to some rooftop with a bottle of red wine. I once bought a container of their homemade red sauce for $5 to sauce up my lasagna. I saw on their website http://www.marcellaslasagneria.com/menu.html that they also cater.

I also tried the Ravioli alla Romana ($12.50) which is handmade and filled with mild cheese and spinach in a light tomato basil sauce and a bit of cream. It was excellent! Sometimes when I've mentioned the Dogpatch to people, they have immediately said "Marcellas!"

Update: I returned to Marcellas around 2:30pm on a  Thursday afternoon and has a pleasant meal outside. I was in the shade but there was also some sun. I had a single table to myself as did a few other people. It was very relaxed and the person at the table across from me was casually reading a book. Another guy was completely finished but continued sitting there enjoying the sun. Very much Italy paced. Seating outside is limited so it's probably best to come after the lunch hour is over. I had a glass of Rose wine to accompany my ravioli and I think it was a good decision.
author: Sara M.

description: The lasagna and fettuccine were out of this world good. The Abruzzo lasagna was cheesy and the sausage had amazing flavors of fennel. Loved every bite and will definitely be back!
author: Jenna J.

description:
I only write Yelp reviews once every few years, but I can't not tell you why Marcella's is the last bastion of hope in this increasingly confusing country.

This morning, I woke up a little later than usual, enjoyed a slow morning, watched the sunlight gently fall onto the floor of m'ladies loft and took stock of my life. After a brief shower, I slipped on my loafers, donned some denim and embarked on a meandering stroll through the DogPatch neighborhood. I was lost deep in the throws of an existential thought cycle, wherein I ask myself how I've come to reside in this city, or any city for that matter, and whether I should retreat away from these urban confines towards a more pastoral, idyllic life I envisioned in my youth. 

BOOOMMMMMM! Suddenly I'm standing in front of Marcella's with mixed feelings of curiosity, familiarity, and hunger. The humble decor, and no-frills marketing intrigued me. I walked in the door, exchanged hellos with the owner, received smiles from all the staff, and took a seat out out on the sidewalk under the sun. 

A waiter promptly took my order before bringing out a steaming pot of dark roasted espresso and fresh bread to my table. I was in heaven. Sitting on the corner in the sunshine downing shots of delicious espresso while waiting for my homemade lasagna to finish baking.

Eating that lasagna was a religious experience. I found god. He was living in Sicily, drinking red wine a little too often, laughing almost constantly, and enjoying the company of a large group of interesting friends. 

Marcella's is what restaurants should aspire to be. A place of comfort, familiarity, inclusion, and satiation. 

Drink red wine, be kind, and enjoy the hell out of your life friends. We're only here for a little while.
author: Chase M.

description:
There is a big difference in fresh pasta noodles in lasagna!  I had the spicy sausage version, which was the special that's available during lunch.  The meal includes salad and soda for $15.  That was a really good dish.  Typically, I only like my own recipe...haha

FYI, all you lasagna lovers...The lasagna menu is only available 3-5 pm.  Sigh...
author: Melinda Y.

description: OMG The Papardelle with tartufo was to die for. My husbands Lasagna Abruzzo was fantastic and he's very picky. And all for a reasonable price. On top of that Gianfranco was so friendly and welcoming; during our meal he must have hugged a dozen customers. People clearly come here a lot and have a great time.
author: Denise K.

description:
When you go somewhere AND ALL OF YOUR LIFE'S DREAMS AND GOALS COME TRUE!
Um, what can I say? Truly delicious lasagna. Many different types, delicious lunch special, nice people. Really , really good. I had the Abruzzo, which was sensational.
author: Ana W.

description: Second time here in 2 weeks. Decided to try the special of the day, linguine adriatico with clams in a white wine sauce and again, everything was perfect. What I love about this place is they understand the concept that more is not always better. They don't try to overload the dishes with more butter or more cream. Instead they use high quality ingredients for all their homemade recipes and the flavors and freshness really shine through. Am going to try coming here weekly until my palate gets bored :) I probably shouldn't cancel my classpass membership just yet...
author: Yin H.

description: It's a place after which you'll be really filled. Got the mushroom lasagna. Drinks selection was good as well. Overall satisfied.
author: Eden T.

description:
Wonderful authentic family owned Italian restaurant. Owners are gregarious, a highlight of every visit.
I prefer their spaghetti carbonara, but their lasagna is also excellent.

A neighborhood lunchtime favorite!
author: Luis W.

description: Small casual restaurant with outdoor tables. Their lasagne is delicious, and so are their pastas. The whole experience as you walk in is perfect.
author: Millie C.

description:
I always thought my mom's lasagne was the best ever, but...sorry, mom. Marcella's is out of this world. We finally made it there for lunch yesterday, and had the bianca, abruzzo, and verdure lasagnes. We all agreed that all three were wonderful, and we can't wait to come back for more. We also had a bottle of barbera d'Alba that was decent for the price.

I don't usually like sitting outside, but that was the only table for three available. It was actually very nice - the weather was decent, and the street wasn't busy. The only thing I would change about this place would be to have it open for dinner too, though they seem to do a brisk take out business so that is an option for dinner.
author: Meredith S.

description:
This is one of our top 3 restaurants to get lunch from at work.  Everything is SO good.  My personal favorite is the Ravioli al Tartufo, although you might want to proceed with caution as it might ruin Trader Joe's truffle porcine raviolis forever for you.  The specials of the day are always delicious; we've had most of the lasagnas on the menu and they are fantastic.

Also: John Franco is a beam of lasagna-bearing positivity on foggy sf days.
author: Daniella S.

description: These guys and their mushroom lasagna is unique and splendid the sauce subtle and delicious. Above all their generous and kind attitude is overwhelmingly positive!
author: Robert B.

description: It's really authentic good everyday Italian food without any fuss. The service is wonderful and personable, extremely inviting and casual.
author: Emerie H.

description:
This is by far THE BEST Italian restaurant I have ever been to in my life!!! You can find me here at least 2 or 3 days a week, and always beyond satisfied with the food and eating experience. I originally came here for the lasagna, all of which are exceptional, and over time I was able to experience the entire menu. Nowadays it's hard to turn away from the daily specials, each inspired from Massimo's Abruzzo roots and a real taste of the Adriatic, paired with the best local and seasonal produce for an unforgettable taste. You cannot go wrong with any item on the menu, especially the lasagna. The dough is paper thin and not heavy at all, the sauces are incredible and the slices they serve are just right on size, everything is made fresh daily.

 It's a family run operation, but by no means is it small. They have a catering business as well and their sauces have won many international competitions and accolades. Do yourself a favor and find your foodie paradise in the Dogpatch.
author: B K.

description: Their lasagne is delicious, and so are their pastas. Pricing is very reasonable for San Francisco and worth every penny! The best lasgna!! And plenty of veggie options.
author: James J.

description:
We needed a place to eat lunch and this resto had a nice menu and did not look too pretentious. Best choice of the day. 

The freshly made pasta was delicious, and the flavors were on-point. You could tell this food was made with love.
author: Bruno C.

description: Amazing and authentic Italian food and ownership. My only wish is that they were open today after I hit up the brewery around the corner. I've not been to the restaurant but I can vouch for the quality of their lasagna and the heart that cooks behind it.
author: Lauren M.

description: Hands down the best lasagna that you will ever eat ! Typical mom and pop establishment tucked away in potrero , only downside is it's not open on the weekends . The marinara sauce they use is just incredible .
author: Bharath C.

description: I had a random craving for super fresh pasta and found this lovely place via Yelp. I don't go to the suburbs often, so it really was quite a craving to get me to leave the city and wander down into Dogpatch (on muni, no less!). So extremely glad I did! The lasagne was amazingly fresh and delicious (I went with classic bolognese for my first visit), service was attentive and prompt, I ate al fresco, everything was wonderful. I'll be back often (plus my favorite ice cream shop is across the street!).
author: Guinnevere C.

description: Recently was treated to a piece of Marcella's lasagna (Bolonese, I think).  OMG, it was seriously the most delicious lasagna I ever remember.  Two pieces from the "lasagna pan" were enough for a fantastic dinner for my boyfriend and myself.  Filling was smooth, creamy, just the right amount of spiciness, and it was very obvious that the meat was extremely high quality, not just an inexpensive ground beef.  5 yummmmy stars!
author: Tanya K.

description: Was trying to figure out what to get for dinner.  Called these guys up and they were going to close shop a little early, but waited for me to get there so I could pick up the Bolognese Lasagna for dinner.  Clear instructions on tray and enjoyed an amazing dish!! Thanks!!  Great food and even better service!
author: Sherman L.

description:
I won't review the food, it was ok (not the best, not the worst), although too overpriced. However, the experience that I got here was horrible.
The son of the owner targeted me as if I was some type of kid without money and treated me badly. He would make sure that I ate something before I used the restroom. (Why would I get into the restaurant get table and the menu, if it wasn't because I wanted to have lunch??)
When I was in the restroom, he knocked the door after 3 minutes, to make sure I hadn't ran away.
When I was back I told him that I had to get something from my car. He made a scene, which was incredibly embarrassing. He thought I was sneaking out. He said: "you only came here to use my bathroom, thank you for using my bathroom".
He was clearly unstable, and I'm sure I'm not the only one that has had a bad experience.
He tried apologizing at the end, blaming his past issues, but I honestly disliked the treatment, and my timing there.
author: Kelvin O.

description: I've eaten here only once (wish they were open more than just weekdays for lunch!) and ordered a tray of lasagna and a tray of pasta here. Love that we have this adorable, family-run gem near me!! The lasagna noodles are so tender they melt in your mouth!! The flavor of the bolognese lasagna is a bit salty for me, but the noodles make up for it. The penne puttanesca is delicious as well! I'm just glad they let you order trays ahead of time - perfect for big groups. I had to resist the urge to tell people I made it myself! :)
author: B. Y.

description:
What I ate: LASAGNA!
Visit date: September 16, 2015
First time? Yes.
 
I was greeted with a smile and the most informative lesson in warming up my  take out order at home. Marcella's is small, and I had heard stories of their fabulous lasagna. I was just never in the area during their restaurant hours...until today! O-M-G. The food lives up to the hype.
 
On this visit I ordered the sausage, mushroom, and butternut squash lasagnas. If you have a choice to heat up your lasagna in the oven or in the microwave, choose oven! All the layers heat up evenly and the cheese melts but does not ooze out oil. The flavors of the lasagna were intense. The sausage had lovely notes of fennel and a little kick. The mushroom had the best textures; there were even crisp onion (or maybe they were mushrooms, too) bits, the butternut squash was toothsome (not mushy!). The gooey cheese, the sauce, and the thin layers of pasta made these lasagnas the 'lightest' lasagnas I've ever had. I am drooling and dreaming about them as I write this post.
 
I can't wait to go back and try other items on their menu.
 
Note: They also sell house-made dried pasta and sauce pairings for $12. Lasagna is served until 5p; other items on the menu are only available until around 330p, but you can call ahead for pick up if you can't make it before then.
author: Erin G.

description: Wow..wow..wow. I'm Italian so I'm very picky about my Italian food. This sausage lasagna is just fantastic awesome delicious and every other word that means great. Salad is so fresh it's like it came right from a garden in the back. Keep up the great work.
author: Paul C.

description:
I've been meaning to try Marcella's... pretty much ever since I moved to the neighborhood. This proved to be fairly difficult, given that they're only open during work hours, and, well, I usually work. But! Thanks to a concussion I received a few weeks back, I ended up getting to finally try their oh-so-famous lasagna during one of my rest days.

Coming in after regular lunch hours, I ended up ordering their abruzzo lasagna, which came out piping hot about ten or fifteen minutes later. For a little under $9, you get a pretty solid, filling slice of tasty, crispy lasagna - though they also have pastas and other dishes (along with daily specials) to try as well.

Chatting it up a bit with the owner's son at the end, I found out that everything they have is handmade the day of, which is largely why they limit their hours: they really need the downtime to rest! That said, they have actually been considering expanding into the weekend, but that's still a bit up in the air at the moment.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A fairly tiny space, with maybe 10 tables inside. Accessible, sort of: the tables are hard to seat at because the style of table legs prevents you from scooting in completely, and the shape of the shop means that only a percentage of the tables are actually suitable for wheelchair positioning.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out.
author: Johnny W.

description: Tie for the best lasagna I have ever had and the other was in Florence.  Amazing meal, great wine, great family and service.  Gotta try it, you will be hooked.
author: Howie K.

description:
A friend took me here as the restaurant was only opened limited hours and he's been dying to go this place. We were here for Monday lunch and it was extremely packed - you can tell there were definitely a lot of frequent customers as everyone was happily munching away at their plates. The father and son immediately greeted us and just like everyone had said, they were super hospitable and got us seated right away. 

We went with the Abruzzo (meat/sausage) and Bianca (white sauce / pancetta) lasagnas and the pieces were large and steaming hot - mostly importantly, they were both sooo delicious. I especially liked the bianca because it was super creamy and the salty flavour of the pancetta really came through. We both completely cleaned out our plates. 

Definite recommend for anyone who is looking for some good Italian homey food!
author: Sherina Y.

description: An authentic, family-operated restaurant where the Lasagna options are all home-made by John the chef, who took over the place from his dad. A few outdoor tables are available for good weather but inside is just as pleasant. Several vegetarian choices make this a nice spot even if you don't want meat. The location near the Muni Dogpatch stop is convenient to Downtown.
author: Joseph F.

description: The BEST lasagna you're probably ever going to find. 12 layers of pasta? Don't mind if I do...
author: Jake K.

description:
Luckily, the chef and his wife happened to have an appointment at my work and we found out about this place.  We quickly looked up their restaurant on Yelp and I knew I would need to try this place out.  After drooling over the pictures for a couple days I finally had a day off to give this place a go.

The place is small, might not look fancy but the food more than makes up for it.  After thinking about what lasagna to go with I decided to try the Abruzzo Lasagna.  Can't go wrong with Italian sausage and spicy tomato sauce.  So while we waiting they brought out some bread with some awesome dipping oil.  Lasagna comes out and I start digging in and I felt like I had those butterflies in my stomach....the kind of feeling like when your childhood crush comes up to you and says hi.  I somehow managed to put down the whole thing, and I regret nothing.  Only thing I wish I would have done is to order one to go so I could eat another for lunch today.  This place is a must try!
author: Scott T.

description: The best Italian food the best service. They treat and great me like family every time I come and the quality of the food is unreal also my advice always get the soup!
author: Alex V.

description: Best lasagna I've had anywhere in the world!  It's a bold claim but if I'm honest with myself it's true.  This place reminds me of being in Europe and it's honestly better than anything I've had in Italy or France (not sure why but this place reminds me a lot of France).  The service is excellent.  It's my dream Friday to  spend lunch here drinking rose and eating lasagna.  Can't wait until the next time!
author: Melissa F.

description:
one could try to have all of the marvelous thin noodle lasagnas, but it will be difficult not to stray over to the daily specials: today's pennette [sp?], with--of course--the delicious and perfectly balanced Santa Catalina vino rosso is a fine example.

Yum.
author: J.Fred D.

description: This is the best Italian place in the city! Great locating amazing food and perfect service! They make you feel like family!
author: Brian M.

description:
This place is great for homemade lasagna in a variety of flavors. You can get meat lasagna or veggie lasagna. A tomato based lasagna or indulge in the creamy bianca lasagna. There are so many delicious choices! The lasagnas are premade and cut and heated to order.

Their pasta dishes are yummy and I got the caprese salad and you get a big ball of burrata cheese!!!!

My only gripe is that it is salty for me. I'm really sensitive about salt so I can taste a dish when the salt is over used. So I don't go as often. But I'm sure I could ask no salt for the non lasagna dishes.
author: Viyada S.

description:
Beyond rude and beyond over priced! 

She didnt even bother to find a solution to my question! Its sad wanted to try this place but with service that rude cant support this business!
author: Ella E.

description:
Wow. I feel like I've never eaten lasagna before I went to this place. GO HERE. And never look back. This is the only place that will ever food-satisfy you after you eat here. 
BLESSED BE THE LASAGNERIA
author: Holly D.

description: I enjoyed eating lasagna and it is very delicious, and the service was amazing! and I will give you a five start, Excellent guys! :)
author: Team M S.

description:
What a super sweet staff! They are totally down to earth & pleasant, a little bumbling but in a totally cute way (the son started us off at our table. The dad came out and took our order. Then the son came out to take our order and then laughed at his mistake).

I think you're supposed to order at the counter and I honestly wasn't expecting table service, but they treated us very grandly for such a local, small, family-owned spot. They have very hearty, soft pasta, and even if it is reheated for our meal, I couldn't tell - it tasted so dang good!

Cost: $13 for a single serving with tax/tip.

Wait: None on a Thursday lunch at 12:30pm. It was a gloomy day so I imagine a little less traffic than normal, but there was a constant flow of customers at the counter and the other tables.

* Butternut lasagna - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/marcellas-lasagneria-and-cucina-san-francisco?select=schFBKL3eMqKqoW1fQ-6eA#schFBKL3eMqKqoW1fQ-6eA
I just love butternut squash and had to get this - while all the components were great and this was really unique, to be honest I think squash just doesn't go well with lasagna. After trying this (and nothing against them, I imagine this is as good as butternut lasagna is going to get!), I realize that meat just tastes better in lasagna, is more hearty, and the flavors pair better w/ the tomato sauce. Of course, the actual pasta itself in this dish was great.

* Abruzzo lasagna - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/marcellas-lasagneria-and-cucina-san-francisco?select=schFBKL3eMqKqoW1fQ-6eA#LAiqOHszzUFt7FK-zg5oHQ
Really great! To my point above, the meat one tasted much better, and there was a lot of it! The texture was very soft, the tangy tomato sauce was really flavorful, and the pasta was great.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Today, I had the pleasure of enjoying the most delicious Lasagna and Black Truffle and Mushroom Ravioli I have ever had in my life! The first bite literally brought me to tears of joy! 

Son and Dad take pride in making everything from scratch each morning! Artesanal cuisine like this is not easy to find!  

This is the beginning of a long lasting relationship for me! Which I don't ever want to end and will keep coming back for more!
author: Claudia R.

description: One of the best lunch spots in the city, the hospitality is off the charts and the lasagna is to die for. Great wine as well.
author: Kimber S.

description:
John was amazing.  He was inviting and helpful to the 1st timers at his establishment.  

Abruzzo lasagna and Penne Puttanesca pasta with mushrooms was amazing.  The pasta was al-dente.  The combination of ingredients for the sauce is a magical wonderland together.  The lasagna was incredible as well.  Perfect balance of sauce, cheese and pasta.  I can not wait to go back and try more things from the menu.  The food, service, and weather was perfect.   We savored every morsel of food.  Sat outside due to the amazing weather.  Sipped a bottle of wine and enjoyed my best friend's company.  

I found a new love with Italian food in the dogpatch.  We will definitely be back.
author: Anna C.

description:
Stopped in today after an appointment at UCSF and couldn't be happier that I did unless I brought home more lasagna!  Tried the house lasagna, red pepper soup and the plate of the day. The lasagna is exceptional. This can only come from many years of experience and trial and error. The noodles are so thin and perfectly layered. I heated this in my oven for dinner and it sliced perfectly without falling apart. The sauce has a gentle kick of heat to eat and I almost fell off my chair when I paired it with a Cote du Rhone (sorry...we are French here) because the flavors were perfect together. The cheese, the sauce, the consistency...perfecto! Cannot wait to go back for more. It's helping me look forward to more doctor appointments! 

The soup was top notch as well. I ate my entire bowl with planning not to do so. I normally would find this flavor so exciting but they really did it well. Side note, father and son were super helpful, fun and welcoming.
author: Maria G.

description: Very casual, great food and very importantly, priced right. The service is run by attentive and friendly people.  San Francisco has plenty of good food, but service and prices can be up and down. We need more places like this.
author: Jason P.

description: I cannot say enough, for this family owned, about how good this place is. I felt like I was back in Italy  (Spring time) and enjoying lunch. You want a place that enjoys your company. Please stop by. John and Papa is great.
author: Anthony B.

description: I'm not going to say this is best restaurant I've ever eaten at, since food much like movie opinions, is an emotional one as much as a rational one. This place though sells amazing food, and the right emotion to complement it. Fantastic food, each of the daily special's is amazing, and you're served by classical Italian friendliness. I've enjoyed all of the specials (8+ so far) and items I've ordered off of the menu. My only knock is that eating here can be pricey, but you are also having gourmet food and a gourmet experience. A trip here is a treat, not a daily routine. However, it is routine for the staff to treat you like family. Come here if you're having a bad day!
author: Daniel N.

description:
My man had a business lunch meeting here, & I requested he bring an order of lasagna home for me to try later.  The mushroom lasagna, please.

OMG.  This mushroom lasagna was UNBELIEVABLY good.  It was divine, pillowy perfection.  

It actually MELTED IN MY MOUTH. 

This is after it had been in the fridge for several hours & reheated for dinner. 

Blissful.

Then...there's the next day.  The following morning, I thought it'd be a good idea to warm up what was left for breakfast.

Again, it actually melted in my mouth.

This lasagna is easily one of the best lasagnas I have ever had.  Flavors & texture both crush it.  The way that the pasta is so divinely soft, yet not at all over cooked, is mind blowing.  

This lasagna rivals, & is even perhaps better than, the lasagna from Italian Homemade.  What?!

Further bulletins as future taste tests warrant!

I'm not sure who Marcella is, but she is a lasagna master.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: By far the only place I'll ever want to eat lasagna from again. This place spoils me every time with authentic ingredients, precise cooking, and a welcoming spirit. Gian Franco is a legend that puts in the work to make this one of my favorite restaurants.  Can't wait until my next visit!
author: C B.

description: Great food, ridiculously friendly staff. A great gem in my local neighborhood.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Restaurants that offer service that makes you feel like the most important person in the world and treat you like a friend always have a special place in my heart. Even if the food is mediocre (And it's not here, we will get to that), outstanding service can more than make up for it. Marcella's Lasagneria is probably one of the best restaurants in the Bay Area for service, and believe me, as someone who was born and raised in the Bay Area and is a foodie, that is saying A LOT. The owner and his son make you feel straight at home and offer true Italian hospitality to all of their customers. I have been here a few times now and receive the same great service all of the time.

However, this aspect is just icing on the cake. The food itself is delicious. I am a huge lasagna fan and this place definitely does the job of satisfying my lasagna cravings. I've tried several of their lasagnas including the bianca and sausage lasagnas that are great as well as their black truffle ravioli, which is equally as delicious. I want to try some of their other dishes but I just can't deviate from getting their amazing lasagnas. You can definitely taste the wholesomeness and the love in each of the dishes. If you are a lasagna fan, you definitely need to stop by here. You will not be disappointed.
author: Kunal N.

description:
Hm...I wasn't all too impressed with the lasagnas. We tried four versions -- the pesto, the eggplant, the mushroom and the butternut squash. I believe all the lasagna they serve were previously frozen and it shows. I think no matter how good something is, if it's not fresh, the taste shows. The sauce tasted like the ready-made stuff that's been sitting in a can, it's dull and lifeless. I was so disappointed because of the good reviews and the place is just so cute, I really wanted to like it. 

Our waiter was very friendly and the place had the feel of a neighborhood joint, but man, they've gotta improve the quality of the food.
author: Alice W.

description: Hands down the best lasagna out there.  I got the butternut squash and my daughter got the Italian sausage. The kitchen closes at 3 so only take out is available after that. The owner is the sweetest. This will become a staple for us in the dog patch area:)
author: Kate W.

description: Best authentic Italian in town.  My favorites are the caprese salad sans greens (just the traditional style with fresh basel and tomatoes), abruzzo and verdure lasagnas and the carbonara.  Must go to this place!
author: Adam S.

description:
Excellent lasagna! I typically don't go for this at lunch because it's so heavy, but this was made with thin layers of pasta. Generous portion size. 

It might have been my timing but the service was ok. The waitstaff is manned by the owner and his son, the son was friendly when he came out, but I saw the father first and wasn't even really acknowledged by him; meanwhile he was telling stories with other newcomers.

Other than that, it was a quiet experience with great food.
author: Brian H.

description:
This isn't your mother's lasagna or at least my mother's lasagna since I don't know your mother, even though I'm sure she's a lovely woman. Actually my mother didn't make homemade lasagna. She defrosted Stouffer's Family Style Lasagna with Meat and Sauce, and that's how my lasagna expectations were set. Ultra thick noodles with ruffled edges layered on top of each other with ground beef, mozzarella cheese and tomato sauce in between. I liked it so much I made my own version for college potlucks. I only knew how to make lasagna and key lime pie.

That was my entire cooking repertoire as a Berkeley undergrad. But I digress since chef Massimo Di Sciullo creates his own unique version quite unlike what I've experienced. First, the handmade pasta is extremely thin like tissue paper. Six layers of this pasta are piled on top of each with three cheeses in between - not only mozzarella but also Parmigiano Reggiano and bechamel - and six variations of fillings and toppings in separate trays in the display case (photo: http://bit.ly/ZTa52W). The net result looked less like traditional lasagna and more like a savory baklava with layers upon layers of filo dough.

I naively asked if I could have half-orders of two different kinds thinking I was at Humphry Slocombe negotiating between scoops of Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee for the price of a single cone. In a halting Sophie's Choice-like moment, I finally decided to try a sizable $9.75 piece of the Verdura Lasagna with fresh pesto, diced zucchini and sun-dried tomatoes (photo: http://bit.ly/10yhvd8). It was quite good, different and fresh-tasting even if it was a tad oily from the pesto. I liked the crunch of the zucchini mixed with what I believe were remnants of pine nuts. Delicious comfort food.

It made me curious what the others tasted like, but I behaved and simply ordered the $4.50 Insalata Fresca as a side. The salad was just a mix of organic greens with a couple of tomato slices on top and tossed in a sweet housemade balsamic dressing (photo: http://bit.ly/16lrYLC). The salad was a wise contrast to the richness of the lasagna. Massimo obviously knows what he's doing since he's had his business for twenty years, although the sparse cafe itself is barely a year old. The limited hours - closed on weekends and only only until 6:30PM otherwise - make it less convenient for anyone outside of Dogpatch, but if you do feel that cough coming on (hack-hack), maybe you can leave work a little early.

FOOD - 4 stars...artisan lasagna...who knew?
AMBIANCE - 3 stars..simple cafe set-up, no big whoop (photo: http://bit.ly/12ijq3W)
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...pretty attentive
TOTAL - 4 stars...quite a different pasta worth trying if you can make it before it closes
author: Ed U.

description:
Mama Mia !

Marcella's Lasagneria... is a gastronomic gem. Finely hand crafted lasagna, nicely composed salads and a homey style of service. Itsa popular joint @ lunch and deservedly so. The owner/operator family consistently delivers a delicious meal. 

Its a rare event to have a chef create a version of a traditional, well "known" dish that causes the eater to reconsider their expectation of it. Witness the detailed familial accounts of lasagna, reportedly served by maternal family members establishing the reviewers fond remembrance of the dish, or even of grated cheese. ITSA revelation, a life changing event, a mind shift that Marcella's achieved with .... LASAGNA ! Such touching and sensory accounts should inspire a visceral reaction of: "oh, isn't that sweet", but the "mind shift" is the real thing to notice. 

Marcella's Lasagneria elevates the position of lasagna in the hierarchy of what has become a "commodity" Italian dishe. Marcella's is that good ... its that refined ... its that memorable. Marcella's changed my opinion of lasagna. Indulging in ONE "name drop": Massimo (the chef, owner, personality deluxe) creates a solid reason to return to Marcella's. 

Ciao !
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Made a special trip from Vallejo because my sweetie was craving lasagna. What an amazing surprise! Best lasagna I've ever had!

The homemade pasta was amazing! Eight layers of super-thin noodles gave the maximum lasagna experience. We had the sausage and the Angus sirloin -- both were absolutely amazing! My personal preference is the sausage, also homemade. 

Our server was Gianfranco, the owner. He was wonderfully personable and a great pleasure to spend an afternoon with. He took great care of us, and not just the food -- also with the wine selection and dessert. Also, he paid me one of the best compliments I have ever received. 

Pro tip: Take some of the biscotti home with you. it's excellent, way above average. Had it the next morning with my sweetie's superb coffee.

My one regret: It's too far from Vallejo for a casual drop-in visit. But I'll tell you this: I'll be planning future trips to the Big City with Marcella's in mind! Can't wait to get back!
author: Tom P.

description: This is legit the best lasagna anywhere. It's nothing fancy -- just fresh ingredients done right. My favorite is the Abruzzo, but I don't think you can go wrong here. If you're in the mood for something a bit lighter, the butternut squash is also amazing. The sweetness of the squash compliments the saltiness of the cheese in just the right way. This place totally has what it takes to become a chain in the area. Soooo good.
author: Sarah W.

description:
The only downside to this place is the limited hours.

I happened to be off one day and I came here for a late lunch and was blown away by the food.

I loved the dipping sauce for the bread ( my weekness). I had the white lasagna and man the best part was that crispy bottom layer. 

I have dreams about that layer lol
author: Anne-Mary P.

description:
The best lasagna I've ever had!

After being on my bookmark list for almost a year, my friend and I made it to Marcella's Tuesday afternoon.  As you walk in, Marcella's is small, no frills restaurant with only about 5 two person tables.  

Though there are plenty of options on the menu (soups, salads, lasagnas, pizzas, & panini/sandwiches), I decided to go with the lasagna (they are a lasagneria after all...).  I ordered the wild mushroom lasagna and it was unbelievably delicious.  Served on a paper plate (I did say no frills), the lasagna contained several layers of an ultra thin pasta with a sweet, yet slightly tangy sauce and a generous portion of mushrooms.  For $9.75, my lasagna slice didn't look that big but ended up filling me up without giving me the overly full feeling.

WHAT TO KNOW:
*Vegetarian options
*Closed on weekends
*Credit cards are accepted
*Trays are available
*Street parking 

SERVICE:
The male working was very inviting.  He was friendly from the time we walked in to when we left.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Two words: Mind. Blown. 

This place is amazing; the food is authentic and homemade; and the service is impeccable. I can rave on and on about this place. Had the eggplant lasagna and butternut squash lasagna. Loved both! Also,the olive oil that's comes out with the bread is ridiculously good. They definitely need to start selling it! 

Will be back soon.
author: ella k.

description: Marcella's is awesome!!  After a business meeting at UCSF one of our contacts told us about this Italian place a couple of blocks away with great food. After one visit we were hooked. I have taken both family members, friends and business colleagues with the same result.  Everyone amazed with the food and friendly staff and anxious to return in the future.
author: Barry K.

description:
I've ordered pans of lasagnas for various events and they are always such a hit. The bolognese is in particular a crowd favorite with the thin pasta layers and the yummy, melt-in-your-mouth bolognese sauce. We took two pans on a weekend trip in Guerneville and we ended up eating it for dinner, breakfast, lunch, dinner... until the pans were wiped clean.  They're a great deal for the # of mouths and meals you can feed.  

Tip for ordering pans: call ahead to schedule a pick up a few days in advance. They'll make them fresh in time for the pick-up and then they store well in the fridge for a day or two until it's time to serve them. Marcella's provides easy-to-follow heating instructions so they come out perfectly out of the oven. Save your dinner parties with these lasagnas!
author: Lily L.

description:
My husband and I had two different types of lasagna.

I had the "Verdure" - I will admit, aesthetically it didn't look quite tasty. BUT to my surprise, it was the yummiest vegetable lasagna I have ever had.

My husband had the Meat and it was delicious. My husband wanted to try all the lasagnas after that. We told Franco that perhaps they should have a lasagna platter sampler in the future. :)
Franco is a very friendly guy and stands behind what he tells you about his food. 

Try Marcella's and you will enjoy their food!
author: Canela L.

description:
I've read good things about Marcella's Lasagneria & Cucina, but I never could get there because only open M-F.  Well, I noticed it on my way to Chocolate Lab & it's just across the street from there.  Take the T-Line & get off 23rd St, go back to 22nd & up the street.

After my dessert at Chocolate Lab I decided to stop in.  Very Happy I did.

I got the Wild Mushroom Lasagna to go $8.75 + .74 tax = $9.49, charged it.  It was the Best Lasagna I've had in Forever!  They really know how to make Lasagna.  Lots of cheese, smooth pasta, lots of mushrooms.  Just delicious!  

Closed Sat & Sun, Plus New Years Eve & New Years Day.

Next week Jan 2-4, 2013 they'll have Black Truffles Lasagna with White Cream Sauce!

If you're in the Dogpatch M-F you must get some Wild Mushroom Lasagna!!

Hrs:
M-F 11:30am-3pm; 5-7pm
CLOSED: Weekends
author: Ann L.

description:
This might actually be my favorite restaurant in all of San Francisco (and I've lived and eaten here for quite a while). The lasagna is amazing. They make it all homemade and have their own secret recipe for the sausage. So the food is great, and if you're into food you should definitely eat here.

However, what makes this place above and beyond a normal restaurant is how incredibly happy the owners are to be running a Lasagneria. The father/son team who runs the place are so happy to be serving you lasagna. They love lasagna, and they love their restaurant. Eating there isn't just about having great food. You feel like, "Here are two people in the world who have found their life purpose and true self-actualization." It's amazing. They should write a self-help book about how to find happiness and purpose through lasagna. I would read it :)
author: Kate H.

description:
Given that it's a small storefront with ready made artisan lasagnas in interesting flavors like pesto and zucchini, butternut squash, spicy eggplant, wild mushroom, and of course a classic bolognese ($9/slice) AND NOT named the Olive Garden, I can see why the high yelp ratings. 

It also helps when the chef/owner is a friendly older Italian gentlemen with an accent. It was hard to resist the special handmade pasta of the day when it's being explained to you in one of the classic Romance languages. Plus, I had to commit once he mentioned roasted pork belly in that Super Mario voice. 

*POTD - $12 - handmade noodles, roasted pork belly, sun dried tomato, a drizzle of truffle oil, and grated parmiagano reggiano. 

Overall, the noodles were noticeably dryer, more al dente than the store bought Barilla kind, the sauce really sticks to the noodles. There wasn't that much pork belly, probably half a bacon strips worth. To me, the flavors were monotone though. For the money, I'd rather shell out the extra bucks and take that Tour of Italy at OG's!  (http://tinyurl.com/bkurnhd)



-Menu (http://tinyurl.com/9wp7oft)(http://tinyurl.com/bhjaezk)
-Easy parking
-Ready made pasta - (http://tinyurl.com/bqqc2r5)
author: Earl G.

description:
Standard food, nothing to write about. 
Ordered a special pasta.. asked for something with veggies in it. 
Waiter said - "You want veggies, go to the produce store."
Then he was like - Want chilli in it? 
I said 'lots'. 
He said - "I'll put so much.. make your butt burn."

Don't know why he was being so familiar... didn't like it. Yeah family business.. personal touch etc.. too personal methinks. Not coming back.. can easily skip this experience in my day.
author: Malvika B.

description:
This was definitely the best lasagna I have ever had. I had been craving it for a while so I looked up 'best lasagna in SF' and this was the first to pop up. It certainly lived up to it! They open at 11:30 and offer sit in service until about 3, when they shut off the kitchen. From that time until 5, only take out lasagna is available. The gentleman informed me that if in the future I wanted pasta or salad or anything other than lasagna after 3, to just call ahead and he'd have it ready for pick up. 

The service was EXCELLENT. And even that is an understatement. He was attentive and apologetic about not being able to seat us. Once our food was ready he even walked us out to point out places in the area where we could sit to enjoy our food. His charisma and personality contributed to the friendly ambiance of the place. It's one of the reasons I know I'll be back for sure.

As for the food, it was incredible. The smell, the texture, the mixture of flavors, it was all amazing. I will be returning to try everrrrything on the menu because that it how impressed I was by it :-)
author: Yanet P.

description:
Exceptional lasagne AND choices! I especially liked the crunchi-ness at the bottom, nice!  Really exceptional. And the owner and his son couldn't be nicer.

My only criticism is that they serve on paper plates, and that they bring the salad with the meal, not before. Even though I asked, and he said he would bring the salad first.
author: Gregg A. J.

description:
The lasagna here is magical! The thin layers of homemade pasta truly make the lasagna unique. Perfect lasagna portions are served and you don't feel overstuffed after eating the lasagna as you might with a pasta dish. I tried the bolognese and mushroom lasagna, both of which were flavorful with the right amounts of sauce and cheese. 

The owner is very friendly and it's evident how passionate he is about what he does from chatting with him and tasting the food. Cool points for the rosemary plants outside! I wish Marcella's was open for dinner, and/or on the weekends!
author: Maya S.

description:
The food was recommended to me by a big time SF food lover and I can say I'm not disappointed.  The  lasagna bolognese has a thick meaty sauce that has clearly spent a long long time on the stove.  It's mostly sauce with a 
The place is small and intimate with a couple of tables nicely arranged along the floor to ceiling windows.
author: reed k.

description:
You can definitely tell they make everything from scratch!  the Cappellini my daughter had was good,  not great but good.  Seemed to have more noodles than sauce.  
I had the Bianca lasagna.  Holy shit.  So perfect! ! The hints of bacon & onion all the way through.  Prefect amount of sauce to filing to noodle ratio. The owner was very friendly & prompt.  Very great service,  great prices.. I would love to see some dessert
author: Kathie C.

description: I love this place for being so authentic. The younger man that works here is so nice and remembered my order since the first time I walked in this place. His father is a Grade A Italian Man straight from Italy beautiful accent and all  Aside from that the food is BOMB.
author: Jenny S.

description: I had never been to a lasagneria before going to Marcella's, and all I can say is, go to a lasagneria.  There are other dishes on the menu, but so many lasagnas!  It was hard to choose.  I got the mushroom lasagna which was very good - not watery like my so-called lasagna and a great crispiness to the cheese.  It was a good size portion with a tasty side salad.  Service was good too, quite friendly.  I liked my lasagna and would certainly go back to try other options too.  Lasagneria.  Go.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
I think I was in Italy for an hour.  My friend and I were welcomed by Massimo (father) and Gianfranco (son) and told them that we were from the Peninsula and they treated us like they were family.  The food was amazing, the service was like we were their cousins.  I will definitely go back and try every lasagna and pasta they have.
