The soup that came with the meal was flavorful and mouth watering.  I kept dunking my bread in the soup that when my pasta came, I was full but ate as much as I could.  Can't wait to have the lasagna tonight.

Thank you Gianfranco for accommodating me today so I could bring my friend and her family some food. Raise she's sick and is home from the hospital . I will forever be your faithful customer.
author: Ann I.

description:
I will judge anyone who visits Marcella's and doesn't agree that they kill it with their lasagna and make your afternoon with their Italian friendliness. They are literally the nicest restaurant owners I have ever encountered. 

Extra cool points for being a 'lasagneria.' 

If you're having a hard day at work and don't know where to go for lunch in the 'patch, go to Marcella's because they'll cheer you right up. If you're having an average day or a spectacular day you might as well go too.

I've tried several of their lasagnas and my favorite is probably the verdura. It has toasted zucchini on top and almost looks reptilian but the pesto-y cheesy goodness inside ties all the layers together. I still need to try their pasta specials which friends have raved about.

Today, the son, unfailingly friendly, read my mind and recommended getting half pistachio/half gianduja gelato. That just made me like them even more.

I have never visited Marcella's and not left happy, full, and actually smiling. If I'm going to pay for a meal, this is exactly the end result I want.
author: Sydney M.

description:
By far the best pasta place in SF... bar none!
Go ahead, sit down, relax and close your eyes thinking you're somewhere in Italy...
author: Patrick C.

description: After spending three weeks in Italy this year, I was excited to run into Marcella's this Friday for a late lunch.  It's casual family owned which is exciting to visit and support.  We started with a caprese salad, as an uncooked dish, ingredients are everything.  I expected a healthy number of beefsteak tomatoes, basil and mozzarella.  The tomatoes were overly soft and tasteless.  The mozzarella was not fresh and did not have any taste.  There were just 4 slices of tomatoes and 2 basil leaves served on a paper plate.  I ordered Bolognese lasagna and my dining companion ordered penne puttanesca but they were out of penne so substituted with spaghetti.  My lasagna was not edible, lacked life, reminded me with frozen section heated a few times.  On to the puttanesca, it was supposed to be a pungently delicious dish except pasta was not made that day.  It had an overpowering taste of anchovies and lacked ingredients specifically olives but we succcessfully found about 6 capers.  On a positive note, the owners son had high integrity and did not charge us.
author: Na H.

description:
I just had a terrific lunch here. I didn't really know going in that Marcella's is known for their pasta (a friend had recommended we go) so I (naively) ordered a chicken panini. The guy taking my order (who runs the place with his dad) was totally funny and basically said "you gotta order the pasta". Who am I to argue?!? He made me up a custom dish of spaghetti with the Abruzzo sauce and it was awesome. Just the right amount of heat in the sauce, perfect portion size, and the spaghetti itself was excellent (made fresh on site).

I loved the food and the people running it seem like really great people. Kudos!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Looking for lunch in the neighborhood, and what could be better than a lasagneria?

We tried both the sausage (abruzzo) and the white (bianco).  Both are flavorful.  The sausage is spicy, the bianco rich.  A decent portion size.  Excellent.  Didn't leave a speck on the plate.  I love that they use very thin noodles.  I don't like lasagna made with thick rubbery noodles.  Got the lunch special which also gives you a soup or salad.  We tried the root vegetable soup which was good, with a nice roasted flavor.  Want lasagna?  Come here.
author: TennisBum P.

description: Amazing ravioli and lasagna. Everything is clearly made fresh. Best service. Great for takeout. The lasagna special is a great deal.
author: Diane W.

description:
I look forward to Lasagna nights.  We've pretty much tried them all and all of them are delicious but our favorites are: Eggplant, Mushroom and Abruzzo (in no particular order)  We order 2 of either one of those 3.  

The place is small but comfortable.  You'll see family photos and a fridge full of other tempting delicious dishes.  The owners are super friendly and welcoming.  Love this place!
author: Delilah B.

description: This is definitely one of my favorite spots in San Francisco. A family business that's as good as it gets. Everything they do is made with care and served thoughtfully. If you're eating in, you feel like you're the guest of a gracious Italian family. If you're taking to go, you're guaranteed to be the hit of the party. If I could give them six stars I would.  Everything is delicious, so you're guaranteed to find something that fits your taste. I love their classic bolognese, and it may kick your grandmothers to the curb.
author: Brooks G.

description: These guys do one thing and do it well. Actually it appears as though they make other things than lasagna but why would I go to a place like this and have anything else? It is fantastic. And reasonably priced, and filling, and just a generally chill place.
author: Marco C.

description: I am on a restricted diet and can't eat a lot of types of food, so when the boss treated us to a Friday lunch--our choice--I went online to find where I could get Italian food delivered. I checked UberEats and Eat24 but there was nothing enticing, then I googled Italian Delivery and came up with DoorDash. Lots of selections, and I was thrilled to see Marcella's on their list. I used to work in the Dogpatch so I know Gian Franco and Mossimo, and know their food is top-quality. I ordered the chicken caesar with no croutons, and my coworker got the Bolognaise Lasagna special. Amazing food delivered right on time, and pleasant service when I had called to ask questions before placing the order, despite it being lunchtime and hectic. We will definitely order from here again, and I'm glad to see that at least on Yelp they are getting the attention they deserve!
author: Alyce K.

description:
As the name suggests, this is the place to go for Lasagna or for a large carb overload. I got to try quite a few different kinds and really enjoyed all of them. The Bolognese lasagna with angus beef, wild mushroom and red wine and abruzzo style with house made italian sausage were very good. 

Extra credit for being a family owned restaurant. I wish them the best!
author: Sunil R.

description: For what it's worth, it's the best lasagna I ever had.  Period.  The chef is also super friendly, feels like family every time.
author: Sylvain F.

description:
So like I always dreamed of a place that served lasagna like it was pizza.  You know, kinda like the old school pizza stand at Woolworths at Market and Powell where you could see the pizza, point at it and get it.  Here, you can see the different lasagnas they are serving, point and get it.  Yeah, that was plural - lasagnas.  They make at least three different types a day. They were delicious!  Extremely thin pasta sheets with flavorful sauces and fillings.  I had the wild mushroom and butternut squash lasagna and wished I ordered a second one.  It was so good and went extremely fast.  

So if I'm in the area for lunch and the other places are busy, it's nice to know there's a lasagneria right on the corner.  Lasagneria - pure genius!
author: Maria S.

description: The pesto Lasagna was amazing, so unique and tasty. Loved the atmosphere, felt like I was in Italy for lunch! Definitely recommend to others!
author: Darshita M.

description:
First time coming here. To be totally honest I wasn't in the mood for lasagna but WOW!! I'm super glad I came in to have a bite

I got their lunch special with the butternut squash lasagna...
SO.
AMAZINGLY.
DELICIOUS.
The sauce was this perfectly sweet tomato sauce that didn't overpower the pasta, the squash was cooked to a T & their house salad was very nicely made.

If you've never been here I would absolutely 100% recommend you come in here at least once (although I'm pretty sure it won't be your last :P )

Definitely coming back again & again!
author: Mirna J.

description: Quite possibly the best lasagna I've ever experienced in my life. After talking with the owner, Massimo, I purchased three different varieties (and they were all amazing!!!). Get the butternut squash lasagna (or don't, because you will dream about it forever). It's not ideal to cook it at home, but this was so good I didn't mind after the first bite.
author: Katie G.

description:
So perfect easy lasagna. Really great caprese salad was perfect when every place In sf is using bad tomatoes they seem to have found the last good one! What a nice ball of mozzarella!! It was amazing.
Lasagna mushroom was good a little cool in spots which is fine... The owners are both very charming. Will be back
author: Emily M.

description: Pretty good lasagna.   I got the lasagna bolognese from the take pop up in rincon center inside of longburger.  Cheesy, not super meaty.
author: Michael E.

description: Amazing food and very friendly service! The Bianca lasagna was perfect. I've never been a fan of restaurant lasagna, but theirs is truly delicious. I can't wait to try the other ones they have. Service was exceptional as well. The man who rung me up was very nice. I will definitely be returning.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I had been wanting to check out this restaurant for a long time.  Was finally in the neighborhood.   It's a very casual place.  Friendly owner. Lots of regulars. 

I had the lagnsna with ground beef sauce with side salad.   It took a while to come out of the kitchen,  but the meal was definitely worth the wait.   The lagnsna was delicious, good portion and I  was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the salad lettuce.  Really good. 

So if you're not in a hurry,  definitely check it out.  Inside is kind of small but there is also outdoor sitting available.   

Looking forward to returning.
author: Eleanor L.

description:
On Jun. 20th, my son and I had lunch. To start with, the owner is gracious and friendly. He also is the Chef. I am 81 years old and have never had Sicilian Lasagna nor has my son. My son had the egg plant and I had the Bolognese. Talk about outstanding, rate it at 6 STARS!!!!! I also ordered a Bolognese and a Mushroom lasagna to go for my son and his wife for their dinner pasta that night. We came over from Marin County as my son had found the rest. on line, what a find!!!!!
 As  a Midshipman, at the United States Naval Academy at Annapolis, Md., was fortunate to visit Naples and Rome in 1956. Great food, but Sicilian rates numero uno!!!!! I have had regular Italian lasagna, in many a great rest., but this Sicilian seasoning, texture, preparation of thin layers of pasta is a prize winner!!!!!
We live now in the Paso Robles area, but a trip to San Francisco is well worth it.
Clifford R. Den Otter, 805-835-9811
author: Clifford D.

description: Small neighborhood trattoria of sorts. Everything made fresh each day. I'm not a fan of lasagna but the owner assured me that it wasn't like any other. No ricotta which is a good thing for me. I ordered the eggplant lasagna. Several layers of the thinnest freshly made pasta sheets accompanied by bechamel and a red sauce with eggplant throughout all held together with mozzarella. It happened to be the best lasagna I've ever had!  My colleague has the caprese salad which appears to have been served with freshly imported burrata.
author: Scott K.

description:
I didn't know there were places that called themselves lasagnerias till I stumbled upon Marcella's. Marcella's offers premade lasagna (spotted five kinds during my visit), pizza, salads, soups and sandwiches. They have wine and Italian beverages. They have an upstairs and downstairs no frills dining area.

The lasagna here is different. The layers of pasta are thin and flat, much thinner than usual. Each lasagna features six thin layers of pasta. They say it's low carb.

* Butternut squash lasagna ($8.75): While the tomato sauce was lovely, a little zesty, and not acidic, it didn't complement the butternut squash. The lasagna was soft, almost mushy. There were thin layers of ricotta cheese, tender pasta and tomato sauce. The butternut squash cubes were on top and felt like an afterthought. The flavor of the sauce overwhelmed the flavor of the butternut squash.

The owner, an Italian man named Massimo, is extremely chatty (in a nice way). There's a picture of a younger Massimo hanging above the counter and he looks like an actor hired to portray and Italian chef. 

Sign up for the lasagna frequent buyer program to earn free lasagna.
author: Lolia S.

description: Stopped in this amazing little place while visiting a customer. Met the owners and they whipped me up a awesome pasta dish in a hurry. Great find! Will be back.
author: Mike H.

description:
Update: We did discuss quantities and I did reduce a few things. However, the trays were all different sizes so one tray of salad was much larger than one tray of prosciutto and melon or a tray of vegetables. I believe I asked what size the trays were so I could be clear on how much food I was getting. If at any point they had told me "hey just looking at this order, it doesn't sound like this will be enough for 125 people."  I would have gladly kept the order the same, or upped the quantities. but that isn't what happened. They listed out the portion sizes on the menu, but when it showed up, that wasn't the case. We had to cut a lot of stuff in half to make it go further. Every place is different, so I have to do my best to estimate. 

When you're sending a representative from your restaurant, if he isn't in a position to handle something like that, someone from your restaurant should be and just because he's not in a position to help, it doesn't give him the right to be rude. I've worked in restaurants for many years. If the customer wasn't satisfied, I'd want to make it right. The owner told me it was my fault and that there was nothing he could do to help me. It's really stressful to feed 125 people and when the caterer blames your for what happened, it's really infuriating.

In the end, whether it was my fault for not ordering enough or the restaurant's for not providing enough, isn't really the issue. It was how they treated me after. It was an all around unpleasant experience and this isn't a place I'm going to use again. Hopefully they are kinder to their customers in the future.
author: Katie O.

description:
This is the best lasagna I have ever had! The veggie ones are all amazing - I love the eggplant one in particular :)
I try to come here once a month since I work in the neighborhood, the hours make it a little diffi cult to come here on the weekends or evenings, so I would recommend coming for lunch or in the early afternoon.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Without a doubt it's the best lasagna I've ever had!  The fresh, thin pasta layers they make it with are the differentiator because it feels much lighter after eating compared to typical lasagnes elsewhere.  My favorites are the Verdura and Mushroom lasagnas to the point that I don't get around to trying much else on the menu.

It was also so nice with how welcoming everyone there was to eating with our baby girl on our last visit, we've never experienced such kindness at a restaurant towards our baby!  Marcella's is a family business so it's not too surprising and I'd highly suggest this as a good place where children are welcome.  If a kid is fussy then there's outside seating which might make it easier for them.
author: Ryan C.

description: Best Italian pasta in SF in my opinion! Great food even better people. Go to when I'm able to leave work and great for to go or parties trays.
author: Rio J.

description:
What a great little spot hidden in the city.  We had dinner here tonight and we couldn't have had a better experience.  It is a family run place and the son waited on us, gave us a history of the place and recommended some things to get as well.

The place is small but the food takes deserves all the attention.  We ordered the caesar salad to start which was very good.  For our mains I got the Abruzzo lasagna which had great flavor and kick to it and my wife got the wild mushroom which she really enjoyed as well.

Great family spot with delicious food.
author: Blake B.

description: This dude is super cool, and the lasagna is off the charts man. I randomly dropped by this joint, scooped up a pan of sausage lasagna, and wow. I didn't even realize delicious lasagna actually be. I mean, obviously lasagna is delish, but this is some ridiculous deliciousness.
author: Booky C.

description:
We got lunch catering from this place today, and I was pretty happy with it. The pesto, zucchini, and sun dried lasagna was pretty solid - lots of good flavors and a generous amount of cheese. I'd be happy to eat it again sometime, maybe if I'm around the restaurant sometime.

Their other vegetarian option, the Gluten-Free Vegan Pasta a la Siciliana, was terrible. I will for sure not be getting this if I go back, and I'm guessing most of the people who give this place such a high rating have never tried this. But the pasta was overcooked and just didn't taste good.

But based on my experiences, and others who tried the Abruzzo-Style Lasagna with Housemade Spicy Italian Sausage, I'd say the lasagna at this place is definitely worth a try.
author: Amaresh S.

description:
Highlights: 
- The owner was the friendliest and you can tell from the way that he describes his food/restaurant that he takes pride in everything that they serve. 
- Verdura Lasangna ($9.75): fresh pesto, zucchini, sun dried tomatoes. Portion size was just right, not too much nor too little to leave you overly full or hungry.
- Special of the day was thin thick pasta noddles with thin slices of zucchini and red meat sauce. It was really good. I like this one better as it had just the right amount of flavor from the meat sauce. 

Improvements: 
- Small, limited seating. 
- Everything is compostable (plates, utensils, cups): Yay, for the environment! In terms of decor, not as appealing. Not complaining though, because if the food is good, that really doesn't matter much to me. 

Tips: Additional seating upstairs and bathroom is past the kitchen (you can tell everything is fresh, because I saw everything being prepped).
author: Tracy T.

description: This place is like walking into your grandmas house knowing you are about to indulge in amazing food! The lasagna is some of the best I have ever had!, I just cant tell my Mom that! The service is awesome, they are so friendly and nice. The portions of food is tremendous. You have to try there Abruzzo lasagna and Carbonara pasta, soooooo delicious. This place is the real deal when it comes to lasagna and pasta.
author: Ian V.

description: I really liked this place. I went with the idea that this would be a super heavy meal. It was. But, it was also delicious and made with the same care you'd reserve for family occasions. The family that operates this business really likes to treat their customers. Our server (I believe he's the son of the owner) was genuine, jovial, and attentive. Even when we strolled by after our meal, he acknowledged us again-my own neighbors don't do that. Also, if you are strapped with hosting a family function, pick up the pre-made pan of lasagna-everyone will think you're a genius.
author: Morgan R.

description: Amazing food, customer service. Feel like you're part of la familia. The sausage lasagna is insane and it doesn't break the wallet.
author: Joshua K.

description: The owner is very friendly and the food is neat. A perfect place for a lunch. The restaurant is small, minimalistic and beautiful.
author: Andres C.

description:
Service--1 million stars, met both the father and son who made you feel like friends (on our first visit)

Food--we had the sausage lasagne and it was AMAZING! Unique spin on the traditional thick noodle lasagna your used to...but I love the spice of this one.
author: Amanda M.

description: I can't say enough great things about this place. It's hands down the best lasagna in the Bay Area and the service is nice and friendly.
author: Silvia S.

description:
Every time I come here.... And it's quite a few times,  it's never short of amazing. The Lasagna, the specials, the gelato... I've never had anything I didn't absolutely love. 
They really being  the whole experience. From the excellent food to how they treat you like family every time I come in. 
Definitely one of my favorite places in the bay. It will definitely give any 4-5 star restaurant a run for their money, any day of the week.
If you're in the area definitely give it a try!
author: Brandon D.

description: Tried the eggplant lasagna for the first time as take-out last night. OUTSTANDING! Woke up thinking about it today. Will definitely go back. This place is a must-try. Can't say enough about Jon Franco and Marcella's - smart, caring, wonderful person who makes incredible lasagna. Thank you for making this delicious food available!
author: Gayle A.

description:
This places spoils me every time I'm in SF. Great food and wonderful service. As the name suggests, their lasagnas are fantastic; you can't go wrong with any of them on the menu. Since I can't frequent this place as much as I would like (curses to living in the other side of the country!) I haven't tried anything else on the menu, but I'm assuming that the rest would be delicious. 

Do yourself a favor and eat here! Or not - I'd like it to stay the hidden gem it is.
author: Devy E.

description: Great food, friendly service. Over the years I've seen them get busier and busier as word has gotten out about their spot. Personally, I love their pastas. I've always loved pasta and I keep going back for more. Never been big on lasagna but it's also amazing. Also their chicken cesar salad is great too.
author: Raphaël M.

description:
Oh my lord!! I do not eat lasagne. Hated it growing up. 

I now eat lasagne. They have converted me. I took an entire dinner home for my family to convert them too. And John Franco is a customer service god!

Bam. A regular stop for me now when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Michael D.

description:
I finally made it to try this wonderful hand-crafted, authentic and delicious Lasagna!
I truly enjoyed the fantastic service given from both the Father and Son.

I had Abruzzo and the Mushroom lasagna which were perfectly prepared.   It reminded me that of Grandma's pasta!  It is terrific to find an intimate family business that prepares food SO Good!  The Lasagna was prepared with beautiful thin layers of pasta balanced with home made sauce, creamy cheese, and executed with delicious toppings.  If the portion size wasn't perfect... I would have ordered another square.  

It is certainly a great place to eat lunch or just drop in for a To Go order.  I love this extraordinary food find, and I can't wait to make this a regular stop!!!!

Please... don't tell anyone.  It is our secret.
author: Christine R.

description:
Haven't tried the lasagna yet but the Pacifica baguette is delicious. For a smaller-sized baguette, they are generous with the serving of local salmon and the clerk told me it was slow cured in-house (whatever that means!). The staff is very nice and friendly and demonstrates great service, even to those like myself sitting outside on a beautiful weekday afternoon in the Dogpatch.

My friends had the Marcella panini and Mediterraneo salad. Both looked and smelled great but I needed a little more substance come mid-afternoon during a long workday. I wouldn't come here for lunch if you're starving, but if you need a luxurious lunch and don't want to spend more than $10-12, here's your spot.
author: Jon S.

description: OMG glad we finally tried this place.  Living in Europe you get spoiled with great Italian food.  This is by far the best lasagna in the city.  The opening times are tricky but they said some delivery services will bring it to you.  The people who run it are super nice too.  Very authentic and Italian!
author: ruby r.

description:
We have another winner in the Dogpatch.  I randomly stumbled across Marcella's for lunch with a few coworkers.  The place is pretty small and you can easily miss it.  There are roughly 5 small tables indoors and a few outside.  

When I read the menu I was a little confused when I saw "low carb" in the same sentence with the lasagna.  Apparently the lasagnas are made with 6 thin layers accounting for a small ratio of the overall dish.  They perfected this ratio leaving room for more delicious filling.  I was very pleased with my choice of the pesto lasagna.  The portions were generous and did not make me feel like bloated after finishing my meal.  This will definitely become one of my regular lunch spots.
author: Danny P.

description:
A great little family owned neighborhood restaurant. I tasted three of their signature lasagna dishes and each was very good. The many layers of thin, handmade pasta were on point all of the sauce and bechemel combinations that I tried were delicious. 

It is a small space and is very casual. We were served by the father and son whom own the place and were very attentive, funny and helpful. 

I would highly recommend checking this place out for lunch. My only complaint is that they're not open for dinner!
author: Zach M.

description: Hidden gem in the dogpatch area. Great family owned, mom & pop (& son) place. Service is friendly like your family from Italy. Only recommend coming when you're not in a time crunch. This place gets busy and can take a while but the food always comes out hot. They also do take our orders. We ordered several trays of lasagna for a work lunch and they were great!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Just like New Jersey! If you don't go to Marcella's, you're living like a schnook.
author: David Y.

description: We had a meeting early February in the Dogpatch and they brought us to this place for lunch. Because we were a big party, we were escorted through the kitchen, upstairs into a separate seating area. The lasagna is what they're known for, but their specials are amazing too! The special that day was penne pasta with speck and porcini. I had only had this dish once before, in Italy. When I tasted it and closed my eyes, I was transported to the hills of Northern Italy, as if I was eating in Mama and Papa's own kitchen. We've been back several times and the specials were mouthwatering each time. The most recent trip a few weeks ago we had fish meatballs with spaghetti. They never over-sauce the food, and the pasta is perfectly al dente. This is the best lasagna and pasta place in SF.
author: Yale Z.

description: Wow, what a breath of fresh air in SF! This little establishment seems tiny...hidden away in an unassuming little alcove on the corner of Tennessee and 22nd. Then... the larger than life owner comes out to great you, excitedly rubbing his hands together in anticipation of telling you what he's prepared for his guests. And what a great guy...he's so excited and proud of his dishes! I had the mushroom lasagna...that had to be the best lasagna ever, something I thought would be pretty hard to achieve for a absolute lover of all things lasagna like me. I can't wait to go back and try a different flavor!
author: Nick J.

description: Why haven't I done this before!!!! Truly epic place, excellent food and impeccable service from truly passionate people. Go here now.
author: M H.

description: Holy s#@*! This place is amazing!!!!! As if the fabulous food would not be enough, the owner is the nicest person I have ever met. You can even get the food cold with heating instructions for home. Run don't walk to eat here or eat from here! They have limited hours so you may have to pick it up early.
author: Lori S.

description: I tasted the Truffle Casserole and OH EM GEE! It was superb! Absolutely delish! I went again and this time they ran out!  oh well next time! I'm coming back! Located in dog patch! Zero parking so cross your fingers you find something otherwise call uber or have someone wait while you run inside!
author: Angel G.

description:
This place is AH-MAZE-ING!!! Fresh lasagna made daily with super fresh ingredients! Excellent service with a smile. Family owned and run. Gian Franco was very friendly and helpful. He knows everything about the menu because he literally made it himself that morning. Best Lasagna in San Francisco hands down. Delicious meat and vegetarian options! They also do catering and large pans for parties. 

Can't wait to come back as soon as possible!!!
author: Carmen T.

description: The food and service are 5 star! I had the Bianca lasagna which was AMAZING! I plan on coming back to try the others. We had come in after they were no longer seating people and they pulled out chairs for us and served us. The staff is very friendly and go above and beyond which makes you want to come back.
author: Amber K.

description:
Lasagna! Who doesn't love lasagna? Anything with layers of pasta, hearty fillings and cheesy toppings and I'm sold. Well lucky me, I've found this father- son, hole-in-the-wall business specializing in making lasagna. 

I was fortunate to try two different kinds; the mushroom lasagna and bolognese. Both def tasted different but had very good, hearty flavors. It's a reasonable portion- not too heavy but leaves you full and satisfied. Pair it with an Italian soda and finish the meal off with some Italian espresso. Mmmm!

Also it makes for a good late night munchie. 

Located in the new and developing dog patch area, it's close to cal train so if you ever feel the need to get some comfort food like this here lasagna, hop off, walk a couple blocks and you'll be happy that you did.
author: Laurel P.

description: I went for lunch with a friend for the first time yesterday. If you could experience heaven through food, you would find it in the Bianca lasagna here!  Incredible flavors. The ultimate comfort food. It was so good that I took home an Abruzzo lasagna with spicy Italian sausage. So different from the bianca, but another amazing experience. Friendly service too!
author: A L.

description:
Never have I walked into a SF establishment and felt this welcomed w/out being overly friendly. The owner personally asked us if we wanted to sit indoor or outdoor and proceeded to explain a little about the food they offer and the fresh ingredients they use. He even opened up a new container of mozzerella which gets shipped here on Mondays straight from Italy to illustrate its freshness and quality. 

This type of effort is something that is lacking quite obviously with many new restaurants that seems to be popping up here in SF where the owner doesn't work to appease the patrons. It's more the attitude of "if you don't like something, tough". 

Both hubs and I stopped by on our lunch break and we each picked up a panini and a lasagna. The panini was extremely tasty and portions were filling.  We decided to save our lasagna for dinner and it was very nice. 

The place may look tiny but apparently they have an upstairs to accomodate larger dine-in groups.

I am a fan.
author: Esther A.

description: Honestly the best lasagna I've had in my life. Try the verdura lasagna!
author: Armando H.

description: I ordered up the mushroom lasagna one hungry afternoon.  I was eager to try this place since I've heard and read such great reviews!  As soon as I got the lasagna, I dove right in.  I am happy to say that there weren't any burnt noodle edges or any unwanted crunchy textures.  Although, a branch of rosemary did find it's way into my meal.  With that being said, the flavor of rosemary was overpowering and I didn't really taste the homemade marinara or the wild and meaty taste of mushroom.  The pasta was cooked well, but I feel like the sheets were cranked out too thin (on a 6 or 7 gauge on the pasta roller).  I definitely want to revisit this place and try a different type of lasagna.  I think the day I came was just a bad day.
author: Josh S.

description: I ordered 4 lasagna trays for a graduation party (butternut squash, sicilian eggplant, artichoke and mushroom) and all were amazing. I picked them on a friday, kept them cool in a cooler chest and cooked them a day later on Saturday each was unique and great. I think I preferred the butternut squash but the artichoke was also very unique. Highly recommend.
author: Mr. S.

description: We stumbled into this pmace after a visit to the nearby museum of craft and design. It was fab - best lasagna ever, great value and lovely staff/owner who seemed genuinely pleased we were there.
author: Karen B.

description: This place is amazing! Great customer service and very attentive workers! My husband and I came in during rush hour and they were still able to accommodate us and make us feel welcomed. We both had their lasagna which was AMAZING. The food was definitely to die for. I would definitely come back while in SF.
author: Evelyn M.

description: Best lasagna I have ever had.  Had the abruzzo and the verdura.  I don't know what makes the lasagna so magical but I imagine it has to do with how thin each layer of pasta is in the lasagna - there's also probably 10-15 layers of pasta in it.  A bit steep at $11.50/serving but after the first bite I had no regrets.  I can't wait to go back to try all the other lasagnas. Great staff with a great sense of humor.
author: Christopher L.

description:
My husband and I usually aren't able to have lunch together during the week. Since we could today, we wanted to go somewhere special, recommended by friends. The restaurant has indoor and sidewalk seating. It's an unpretentious place- everything is served on paper plates. It's owned and run by a family that fairly shine with love for what they do. The son greeted us, mom was on the register, dad was cooking and everyone was watching over the tables together. We overheard the dad tell another table that they name the restaurant after his daughter. They were all attentive, warm, and generously spirited - very genuine in how they made us feel like old friends. We ended up spending along two hours eating lunch, though I felt like we'd been there for only 30 minutes or so. 

We had Caesar salad, the pork pappardelle special, the sausage lasagna, gelato and a biscotti. Everything was excellent. The lasagna and gianduja gelato were particular great. The lasagna is a generous portion, with paper thin sheets of pasta, just the right amount of homemade sausage with fennel, and the sauce! The sauce had this richness and the sweetness of tomatoes cooked for a long long time with care and attention. It was a beautiful, subtle, nuanced sauce. I've never had lasagna like this before and didn't know the dish could be this interesting and delicate. 

All that and it was pretty inexpensive to boot! Our whole meal, with salad, two entrees, and dessert was only about $40. (Speaking of money, it looks like they take American Express and are on Credibles.) 

With so many places to eat in the city, 9 times out of ten we aren't impressed enough to return. This lasagna is now in our list of very favorite things to have and we can't wait to return.
author: M B.

description: We got catered lunch from Marcella's. Food was fresh and healthy with lots of veggies. Mediterranean mountain salad was really good. Fusilli was decent. Overall, food was heavy/oily. I was full but not satisfied.
author: Thea S.

description:
I can't find the words to begin this other than: this place has the best food I have ever tasted, and is the least pretentious restaurant I have ever been to. 

The food and the presentation clash mightily for that they are. The plates are dixie paper plates on small wicker holders neighbored by little paper napkins. The soup comes in little plastic containers like the kind you used to use when all your bowls were dirty as a kid, and you needed something to hold your goldfish. They contain food that surprises me every single time with how tasty it is. I do not understand how it still blows me away, despite coming here for nearly a year. 

This is simply good food. Other restaurants take the claim that they are 'simple' and 'good', but these words have lost their meaning through over- and mis-use. This place *lives* those words. 

Eating here feels like living in some parallel universe where that quaint, sepia-toned idea of antiquated Italian countryside ristorante exists, but it's in San Francisco -- home of smug pretension -- fighting back with such authenticity that you expect to be smacked on the back of your head with a wooden spoon used to stir marinara by your Nonna for letting your food get cold because you've been lost in how rare a place like this is. 

I considered not writing a review, because so many others have said what I've said, but better worded. I considered leaving a 1-star review so that people won't discover this place and leave me unable to find a table at lunch -- but quickly dashed that idea because I could never do that to the people running things here (a family, father and mother making the food, and son running the front).  Instead I'm leaving these five stars, sad that that is the most this site allows me to give; and I'll be coming here until this blip of perfection in this wildly imperfect world ends.
author: Mike M.

description: What can I say. I'm a local and this is where I want to eat every meal. They aren't open for dinner yet so every lunch will have to do. The special is ALWAYS worth ordering if you are a good and happy eater. Picky-eaters to the back of the line. The Lasagna is best in the city, probably best in California. Gianfranco and Massimo are not F&$king around. Roman cafe on a corner in the dogpatch.
author: Marty S.

description:
Let me keep this simple: I think this was really hands-down the best lasagna that I have ever had.

The salad was only so-so, but I mean who really cares, it's not like anyone is coming here for the salad. Did I mention, it was the best lasagna that I have ever had.

P.S.-- Great coffee too
author: Justin D.

description: Truly, an authentic Italian meal and pleasant experience overall from food to service! Very pleased with the meal; ordered Chicken Rigatoni paired with Caprese Salad, both of which had great distinguishing flavor as well as a remarkable freshness. The gentleman who assisted (our) table, John Franco, did a phenomenal job touring me and my brother through the menu, recommending the Rigatoni con Pollo which includes chardonnay sauté that he made from scratch earlier that day. It turned out a great choice as it watered in my mouth, very "al dente" like true Italian pasta should be and amazingly delicious! For dessert we enjoyed a scoop of gelato each which by the great flavor and smooth consistency one can spot it to be the real thing-By far, the best artesian-made gelato I've had, paired with a made-from-scratch biscotti, Y-U-M! John Franco suggested a limoncello to top off the meal which did us a great deal in our tum tums to bring the good food flowing down nicely; a satisfying after feel. Aside from a great authentic Italian meal, I absolutely grew fond of our server John Franco who made the experience from sitting to closing the meal an all around delightful experience for me and my brother. John Franco has a wonderful, witty, all-giving personality which is a complement to the great food. Rarely do me and my brother encounter service derived from the heart like Franco's. He was an outstanding server! Definitely will come back for the awesome food and to experience his service all over again.
author: Lorena C.

description: My first time really exploring the Dogpatch... and what a wonderful introduction. Marcella's Lasagneria is a cozy spot on the corner with a little bit of outdoor seating. Their lasagna pasta is very thin so unlike most lasagnas, you are not chewing through under and/or overcooked thick pieces but delicious thin pieces that melt in your mouth and all the fillings are so fragnant and distinct, far more than just cheese. I tried the Abruzzo with spicy sausage and the mushroom - both delicious. The pieces I got had that amazing crust on the sides... as well as on the bottom, perfection. The chef who greeted us - GianFranco - was funny and inviting and made us feel very welcome, despite stopping by right at 3:30 (they only do take-out 3:30 - 5 pm and aren't open for dinner). I think I'll be coming back next time to order a whole pan.
author: Suzanne V.

description:
I love this place!  The lasagna is, without doubt, the best I've ever eaten. The thin layers of pasta give it a very unique taste and texture. 

But as good as the lasagna is, I now just have the daily special, whatever it is. And I haven't been disappointed yet. 

The passion that Massimo has for good food comes clearly through in every dish. And Gian Franco makes everyone feel like they're home. 

Enjoy some of the best and most authentic Italian food anywhere in the city. And finish it off with a perfect espresso and biscotti!  

Deliciosa!!
author: Aidan C.

description:
A small dad-and-son restaurant gem in a middle of industrial neighborhood. Their specialty is lasagna and it definitely delivers. From the hand made pasta to the sauce and top off with crisp from the grill, their lasagna is the best I've ever had. 

On top of that, they give you a very generous amount of espresso, delivered in a steel coffee mug made in Italy. The coffee is thick as in Italy and taste as good. 

Paired with the food is the super friendly service of the 2 owners. They talked and chatted with you and the other patrons and you can see a lot of folks are regulars here. The environment is very family-friendly. 

5 stars. Definitely will come back for more food.
author: Erick K.

description: While on my first visit to Marcella's Lasagneria in their Dog Patch location I was told they were opening up a location in the Rincon center after the 4th of July. Just went here the other day and I have to say that although they share the location with a burger place the food is just as good. Not as expansive as their flagship location but if you're in the mood for lasagna then this is he place for you.
author: Mike C.

description: This place is a gem. Family-vibe, authentic, attentive and passionate staff... oh AND the food was absolutely delicious.
author: Kathleen L.

description:
The best lasagna I ever had in my life. Hands down. My whole family loves it and my extended family loved it too. Go there and check it out for yourself and see what I am talking about. 
I ordered the Abruzzo lasagna....and it was awesome.
author: Nishant S.

description:
I've worked in the Dogpatch for 2 years, and this is one of my all-time neighborhood favorites for lunch. Family-owned, daily specials, everything freshly made, super friendly service. 

My favorites are the pesto and butternut squash lasagnas. Totally worth breaking my no-carb diet for. And the caprese salad is also on point. I've also tried a couple daily specials, which range from pastas to lasagnas to meat/fish dishes, that were very good.

Pro-tips: "Like" their Facebook page to receive DAILY UPDATES on the daily specials. They also do catering! They did our office (150+ people) a few times and it was amazing. I may or may not have brought a 3/4 eaten tray of lasagna home for further consumption....
author: Jessica W.

description: Excellent service and great variety of food on the menu. The only wish is for parking to be more available, but if you come after lunch time it should be fine
author: Elpie K.

description:
Mamama would approve.

She is my dearly departed Italian great-grandmother. This place is a dearly loved Italian shop in the Dogpatch.

Each can be described as warm and personable. Each are also well known for excellent Italian dishes.

Fond memories of freshly grated Parmesan cheese on Mamama's spaghetti. Fond memories of butternut squash in a six layer tomato sauce in Marcella's lasagna.

Marcella's also comes to the table with a namesake sandwich featuring grilled vegetables. Pretty sure Mamama had a sandwich too.

No charge growing up. Reasonable $16 + tax/tip today.

Lucky to have come across both.
author: Jason B.

description:
Lasagna paradise!

That is.. if you like their thin crepe layered version of lasagna, and I did! The crepe layers make for a lighter and more delicate lasagna, different from what I am used to, but oh so good.

The only criticism I have is that some of their lasagnas are too similar tasting to each other, yet all are good. (Mushroom and sausage and Bolognese seemed similar, Verdura, butternut squash.. very different)

The owner and his son are very friendly and helpful as well. Recommended for a unique and delicious lasagna experience.
author: M D.

description: Down in the dumps after 11/8, so took the Huz to try the lasagna at Marcella's. We sat outside in the beautiful sunshine and the Huz ate like it truly was the end of the world. We met father and son, and they were warm, kind, and funny. The Huz stopped eating lasagna when his Grandmother (from Parma) died because no one could touch it. Well, at least until 11/9/2016. We're going back on 11/11 so he can load up on more Marcella's delicacies. A true find.
author: Cydney B.

description: The mushroom lasagna is fantastic! This is truly gourmet and fine dinning type of lasagna. So amazingly delicious. I am excited about coming here in the future!
author: Laila J.

description: The best mushroom lasagna I've ever had, thin and flavorful and the customer service was on point. The restaurant is small but the food makes up for it. I will be visiting this place again on my next trip to SF.
author: Jeovany V.

description:
Second time here, same impression both times. Great father and son team. Both are very friendly and nice but do need a little help with service. Offered to bring  bread, never came, had to remind him of my drink order, served us well before the next table whom had ordered before we even sat down, we were told to go inside to pay the bill while others were taken care of at the table as in a regular restaurant. None of these things are a big deal but were noticed and takes away from the experience when you feel a need to pester the waiter for what you ordered.
The food : at $11.50 for a piece of lassagna, and the great reviews , I was expecting something different and tasty. I found the lassagna mushy and good but not special. Stouffers frozen comes to mind. It was not hot, on a paper plate, and just didn't stir any taste buds beyond satisfying my lunch hunger. My friend had the eggplant lassagna, even more mushy. Salad was good, hard to go wrong with greens and a simple vinaigrette.
I don't know the food seems uninspiring and expensive for the offering. Very nice and friendly owners. But after two visits with the same impression I will pass next time.  With all the 4 and 5 star reviews I can only think it's because there is nothing else in the neighborhood to eat. Too bad cause I really wanted this place to be a go to destination. It just didn't cut it for me.
author: Matt A.

description:
Well it's kinda kooky to compare this to a burrito joint as many 3 star reviewers mentioned. I'm 6'3" and solid 185 and a slice sets me straight for two meals. With a salad.  I've only done take out.  Once you cook food it must bee refrigerated.... Food safety 101!  Gosh some yelpers.  The poor reviews disappeared? 
Chef du jour
author: JIM M.

description:
Reheated lasagna on Chinet. I'm sure it would be better if it were warmed all the way through. But it tasted like leftovers not microwaved long enough. 
It's good that the waiter, who seems to be the owner's son, is enthusiastic. 
This place has a ton of potential. I'll go back to try it again, but I hope my food is warmer next time.
author: David S.

description: Most delicious lasagna I have ever had. Amazingly friendly owner and son, always a good time when I come here. Not only a great place for lunch, but take out is always ready when you want it. I HIGHLY recommend  Marcella's, it is spectacular.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: "We no longer serve food. We serve emotions." - Owner (son). And he's right! I sought out Marcella's while craving for lasagna and I got exactly what I wanted- insanely delicious lasagna. I got to the restaurant at around 1pm on a Wednesday and it wasn't too packed; I was able to sit outside right away. John/Gian the owner (I'm guessing this is his name based on other reviews) greeted me and was so warm. It felt like I was talking to an old friend right away. He made me feel welcome and right at home and had a smile on his face the entire time as he ran around and in and out of the restaurant. Talk about service! He took the time to go through the specials of the day and the menu which I appreciated very much. I went with the sausage lasagna lunch special. It's like butter and each bite just melts in your mouth. It is truly comparable to lasagna I've had in Rome. John even hooked me up with the "best slice"- corner with a little bit of crunch on the bottom. Great quality meal for a great price. I had to order another one to take home! Easy to heat up, too- 400 degrees for 12 minutes. Tastes just as good as it did fresh out the oven. I'm looking forward to going back to try more dishes (I've got my eye on you, mushroom lasagna!). Geez I might even go back tomorrow cuz I miss it already!
author: Monica T.

description: Really good homemade Italian food. Owner and workers their are extremely nice.
author: Steph R.

description: What a wonderful place. Family run and everyone so pleasant & friendly. Food was wonderful and very fresh. I am in town on business & co worker from SF comes here almost every day. I finally came as every time she would come back to work with lunch I would smell amazing. I am glad I finally came and will be coming back more often. Not enough Restaurants truest knows what Al Dente pasta really is. Well done & thank you. A must try.
author: Janna W.

description:
This place doesn't deserve the 4.5 stars it currently has. I rarely write reviews but I feel a need to inform people since the food quality at this place is EXTREMELY out of line with its rating.

It's a family owned business and the staff is friendly, for sure. Another plus is that a restaurant dedicated specifically to lasagna is a novelty I haven't seen elsewhere.

When it comes to the quality of the food on the other hand, it's pretty middle of the road. The lasagna was made beforehand and reheated (you can verify this by just looking in the area under the counter where it's stored), so the pasta component is soggy. We shared three different flavors. I think they were the sausage (best one), the mushroom one, and the meat sauce one.

Service was also slow. This was on a weekend and the place was being run by the owner's son. Super nice guy though!

They need to seriously up their game to live up to their rating.
author: kavin s.

description:
So good! I agree - seriously the best lasagna I've tasted. I came with a group right as they opened, and we were lucky to chat with the owner/chef and his son. He explained how he makes his pasta and creates the lasagna - six layers of thin homemade pasta, bechamel between layers. Choose from nine options, including lots of vegetarian choices. I ordered the Verdura which has thin zucchini slices, pesto and sun-dried tomatoes. I can't wait to go and try the butternut squash! They have more than lasagna too, but it's the specialty - how can you NOT order it?? 

Pretty small inside, but all food is served in to-go containers so it's not a problem. 

Great food and super nice people. Support some good dudes!
author: Brittany L.

description:
This place has the best lasagna! Not a lot of people even know this place is around I found out about it from family bringing over leftovers and as soon as I had it I was hooked!
The lasagna has a great Italian sausage in it and is so fresh. I also tried there caprese salad which was fabulous as well it had a great ball of mozzarella inside of it along with very fresh tomatoes and a great dressing to accompany it.
author: Michael W.

description:
Such wonderful food and very friendly and welcoming owners. .  Best tortellini and ravioli that I have ever had.
Lasagna too!  We have eaten in and taken out.  Both were great.
author: Helen S.

description: Great lunch spot. Food is always consistent and service is super friendly. Call it
author: S S.

description: A friend and I stopped in for lunch last Fall after reading the reviews on Yelp and we were glad we did.  We had the mushroom and verdura lasagna. Both were excellent. More than that, though, Gian, who clearly enjoys working in the family business, made us feel right at home. I've been back several times since with similarly positive experiences.
author: Preston T.

description:
How about this addition to our Dogpatch neighborhood?  Outdoor seating and umbrellas.  Family run totally fresh and organic delicious healthy food made to order. 
And, oh yeah, also a good value.
I am so happy to see their great welcome to the hood.
author: Gary N.

description: Che bello!  I loved the Abruzzo lasagna, delizioso!  Folks are speaking Italian and the host embraces many of the guests as they enter.  For what it is worth, I lived in Naples, Italy for a number of years and feel this is authentic experience.
author: Brian G.

description: this place is dope. owners are dope. food is dope. i'm getting horny just thinking about it.
author: Michael H.

description: Incredible! We ordered a variety of items figuring we would have leftovers but every bite was tooooo good. Talk to the owner and feel the passion in every dish.
author: Michelle K.

description:
This place has outstanding food, service, and character! The food is authentic with no yuppie interpretations and served in perfect proportions--just like my nona used to cook for me! The mushroom lasagna is my family's favorite and the pizza was delish! The father-son duo make everything by hand and treat you like family. Gianfranco is especially sweet and thoughtful. He found a special spot for us to sit and propped up my injured leg on a pillow!!! I swear I have been treated so badly by other servers in the city when I walk in using crutches.

This city is riddled with ridiculously pretentious restaurants. Marcella is a refreshing departure from long lines, inattentive service, and jacked up prices. Support these guys hard work and passion!!!
author: Tessa T.

description:
OMG! So delicious! I'll write a more thorough review, but.... I just have to say, they just delivered lunch to my work for a colleague's lunch meeting and I just have post... this food is sooooo delicious! I'm now eating, and getting so full, but want to keep eating the following (and everything is so good!): pea & tomato salad!, mushroom lasagna!, veg pasta primavera!, caesar salad!, garlic bread! The "!" means = delicious!

Thank You Marcella, and your beautiful Italian mother, and sweet assistant, that delivered the lunch.

********************
Update - Next day, today: I woke up thinking about Marcella's delicious food this morning. I'm already planning to high tail it to Marcella's tomorrow, Saturday, to pick up a variety of yummy lasagnas and a few salads and maybe some other goodies to serve at home this weekend.
author: Jules B.

description:
Great food and service. G and his father Massimo are a delight and I think that their lasagna is the best I have ever had-the thin layers give a great texture. Butternut squash is my favorite, but eggplant is a close second.

We also ordered a tray for pick up to enjoy a few days later with friends on a Football Sunday - tasted just as good as when we ate in at Marcella's.

Happy to support this local family owned Dogpatch gem!
author: Kim L.

description:
Probably the best lasagna I've ever had. 
Homemade pasta, very good and friendly service.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
I have been dining here since they first opened and am addicted to the thin, light lasagna! It's the only authentic Italian, family owned and operated business I've patronized ever and I love the atmosphere. The son Jean Franco runs the counter and his dad Marcel is a celebrity in his own right. Try his house specialty the Italian sausage lasagna and then take some home for dinner.

You can buy it cold for heating later or they heat it up for you. It's perfect for when you need comfort food that won't slow you down or put you in a coma.

Also they have delicious salads if you can't go whole lasagna.....
author: Vanessa S.

description: I saw Marcella's Lasagneria  listed as in a top ten foods and restaurants of San Francisco to try. I printed out the menu and called in a lunch order to pickup because I was worried about the parking.  The food is super fresh and homemade pasta.  I want to come back and try the pizza. Glad to know of an Italian eatery in Dogpatch.
author: Infodiva B.

description: BEST LASAGNA PLACE EVER!!! Marcella's Lasagneria is a lasagna focused restaurant that serves unique flavored handmade lasagna, something I have never been to before. Walking in with my friend during to-go only hours, the lasagna maker/owner came out to describe the lasagna himself, and his passion and specific descriptions made the experience excellent. Since we could not decide which lasagnas to order, the owner described each lasagna's ingredients, taste, and his own recommendations and opinions. To say the least, his delectable descriptions did not help us decide. We ended up getting three lasagnas to share: verdura, mushroom, and bolognese. Each one was delicious beyond belief; it was obvious that the lasagnas were freshly made by hand. The ingredients were perfectly balanced with melted cheese and creamy sauces that were full of meat and veggies. The only downside of this place is that they are only open for weekday lunch, so as a student, it is difficult to find time and come eat here, but I will make time since I became completely obsessed with this place immediately and cannot wait to come back and try more lasagna!
author: Annie C.

description:
I tried the Abruzzo lasagna with spicy sausage.

What sausage? There were a few crumbles on top. The edges were hard, the center was cold... 

Boring. I really wanted to like this place.

And it was way over-priced.
author: Andrew H.

description: I was on a walking tour of Dogpatch yesterday. We walked by this place and the smell was so appealing that I returned after the tour and got some Lasagna to go. OMG! Excellent. And the portion feeds 2 people.
author: MaryLynn R.

description: I love this place.  The food is delicious, and the people that own and run it are amazingly friendly and welcoming.  The daily special is usually the way to go.  Highly recommended.
author: wade g.

description:
I liked this place once I looked at the menu. My favorite type of Italian food is Lasagna. They make six different types! My friends and I tried three kinds, the pesto, Abruzzo, and wild mushroom. All three were awesome and all three of them had their own distinct flavors:

Pesto Lasagna - Ummm... pesto-y. When mixed with the cheese it made the lasagna very creamy. Also, a nice strong presence of olive oil. Delicious!
Abruzzo Lasagna - Spicy Italian sausage lasagna. Marinara sauce was very well done, a bit on the sweet side. The sausage gave it a nice kick. 
Wild Mushroom - A bit lighter, mushrooms are not overcooked, nice a soft. They use a red wine sauce in addition to the marinara which adds a slight bit of tartness.

The pasta is wonderful. Most lasagna is pretty heavy but because they use such thin pasta, it maintains the lasagna texture without all the starchiness of normal lasagna.

The service was excellent. They moved tables around for us, took out their phones to show us pictures of some of the food there, and were just really friendly overall. He was definitely Italian from Italy... hilarious guy.

Can't wait to go back!

Cheers!
author: Andrew B.

description: Tucked into a little hole in the wall with some outdoor seating, this food here is amazeballs. Some really exquisite lasagne with house-made pasta that is super super thin. Light and guilt-free; love this place. I also love the enthusiasm of the staff and owner.
author: Robert M.

description: If you can somehow find your way to potrero hill on a weekday in the early afternoon, come to Marcellas!! The father and son are so nice and the lasagna is delicious!! Lots of layers of really thin pasta makes the lasagna very flavorful!! They only make a certain amount everyday and close once they sell out so even though they are technically open til 6:30, make sure to come early!!
author: Clarice C.

description: I was really excited to try this place out, but it was just OK. It's pretty expensive for a piece of lasagna and I didn't think it was spectacular. I had the abruzzo and bolognese lasagnas as well as their packaged minestrone soup. The bolognese was pretty salty and the abruzzo was decent. Minestrone was really watery and had no depth. Everything came up to about $30.00 and I wasn't even full for long. I did appreciate the many layers of noodles, but the taste just didn't do it for me. The cashier/waiter was super friendly and nice. Parking can be difficult for sure.
author: Freckles H.

description: Incredibly great service, great portions & good food. They have a decent vegetarian selection. It is nice sitting outdoors in good weather. This place is family run.
author: Mihir M.

description: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!! Excellent food, homemade pastas, and EXEMPLARY SERVICE. The best place, hands down, in the Dogpatch!
author: Chrystal M.

description:
Viva l'Italia in Dogpatch!

First Piccino... now Marcellas.   You know where this is heading...

Serious cucina in a tiny spot - tiny for how long?  Marcella's is going to be mobbed.  The lasagna transports you to Italy.  The pasta is so silky, so glassy, so fine... you don't even need teeth to enjoy it!  The bechamel sauce is a velvety caress... the mushrooms were perfetto... how easy to indulge on chef Massimo's artisty.  

We also tried a prosciutto / mozzarella pizza.  The ingredients are incredible.  The crust made me think they were really trying hard and rushing to keep up with the lunch crowd...  a couple more minuti in il forno...  but no matter.   

We will be back... often!
author: Bob K.

description:
Classic. Fresh. And truly delicious!
Don't forget to finish with an espresso. 
Great family establishment.
author: N W.

description:
My office used to be right around the corner from this cozy family run joint so I had the pleasure of enjoying the food here quite often. Its been run by the cutest sweetest Italian family for years and you can really tell the food, compiled of what must be generations of secret family recipes, is authentic and made with love. The patriarch of the family Massimo even made me my own pasta after asking what my favorite ingredients were and his son Jean-Franco is just as skilled in the kitchen as his father. I loved getting surprise salads and pastas delivered to our busy office!
Awesome duo who know everyone in the neighborhood and greet people all day long with a smile and always have time a handshake and neighborly banter.
Always crowded at lunchtime so get there early and enjoy the outdoor seating in the sunshine or grab some amazing family sized lasagnas to take home for dinner.
Definitely a great place to go to feed guests if you're having a dinner party!
author: Lilia D.

description: Pasta is as good as the lasagna, and the service is so genuinely nice (coowner father and son)
author: David N.

description: Tasty and delicious Italian food. Ive had several different lasagnas. On point each time. Some Italian coffee after is a great way to end the meal. Very authentic and family Italian feel.
author: Jonathan M.

description: We live close by, I get the train at 22nd street very often and thought to try this place for a long time. Finally I got a portion of classic lasagne bolognesi to eat at home with my wife. I have to say that I had quite high expectations but was sort of disappointed. The pasta is very well made, the tomato sauce, I mean the ragu did not have a lot of taste and also the besciamelle was very blend..... Mmmm.... I hoped for something better. I make lasagne once in a while and I believe mine have a better taste. I am from Emilia romagna, so lasagne are really important in my diet but I still have to find a really good place in town.
author: Luca R.

description: The mushroom lasagna is outrageously great! John, the owner gives you a "welcome home" service. It's worth my drive from Silicon Valley.
author: Noriel A.

description: Tried Marcella's for the first time yesterday with a friend. This is an owner-operated establishment, and the father and son were both very friendly and helpful and it is clear they take a lot of pride and pleasure in their work--really a breath of fresh air in SF. The experience was very pleasant, and the lasagna was wonderful. The prices are reasonable and service was quick. I wish more businesses in SF were like this. Will definitely be coming back!
author: Rosa V.

description: Okay, the food alone merits a 5-star review.  Mossimo has love in his cuisine.  I had an excellent Caprese salad, and the most life-changing baked ziti.  Two glasses of Chianti, and I am ready to move to Dogpatch.
author: Jack H.

description: This spot is a gem. Incredible lasagna. Thin slivers of heaven. Family owned, which makes your experience unforgettable. The son, John Franco - makes everyone feel as if they opened this restaurant, FOR YOU. Incredible service and food made with love. We had the sausage lasagna and butternut squash lasagna and got to try their homemade biscotti - all delicious.
author: Sara K.

description: I ordered the mushroom lasagna togo as recommended by the owner but when I got to the office, it was different lasagna. Anyway I ate it and it was good. I will go back to get the mushroom lasagna and make sure it's the mushroom lasagna.
author: George K.

description:
WOW! 

Best lasagna in town. By Far. Best. Lasagna. In Town.

Don't go there - run there.

Everything is so fresh - you can simply DIE! I mean it is like crazy - you taste the vegetables after they were baked and you can still feel all the tastes, the texture, the pasta itself is paper thin. AMAZING.
author: Too M.

description:
Expensive for the amount that you receive.

The taste was average.

They need to lower the prices or supply a larger portion of food.
author: Evan W.

description: This is the third Christmas I've ordered trays of lasagna from Marcella's. I have not once been disappointed. I've tried the bolognese, the Bianca and the spicy sausage ones... All are absolutely delicious. The layers of pasta are thin and delicate and the amount of sauce and cheese are on point. After three years I don't think I can break tradition now, the lasagnas are just too good.
author: A.D. P.

description:
I have not dined here, but have had the mushroom lasagna from this place at a friends house. My friends Vince and Jonathan know the owners of this place well and for a special dinner at their home a month or so ago, they ordered the mushroom lasagna and baked it at home. They prefaced it with how unique and amazing this was going to be and it will be unlike any lasagna I have ever had. I was super excited while at the same time having no clue what could make any lasagna so different from the numerous lasagna I have had throughout my existence! 
The first ting I noticed was the intense scent of homemade marinara. It was intoxicating. The next thing I noticed was how effortlessly my fork cut through the noodles. It was like they were made of butter. Then the taste.... OMG! And I do not even like mushrooms and was not bothered one bit! I had seconds! I then went to their website the next day and texted two of my foodie friends about this place, which neither had heard of it. I definitely will be coming here for their pest and maybe the truffle lasagna in the near future. Amazing quality!
author: Unicorn U.

description: I can't say I've ever had AUTHENTIC Italian before until now. My first time here, I was blown away. I got the zucchini lasagna and the mushroom soup and it was to die. I came here today to pick up food for my co-workers and while standing there I noticed a picture of the owner on the wall towards the front. Cutest thing everrr. Og Italian. His son handsome too and soooooo nice and corteous. Father and son look so much alike. I love this place because of the environment. It's so welcoming and the small interior really invites you in. The outside is gorgeous with outside seating. So you can wine and dine outside. Food is Delish. Perfect! 5 stars!
author: Priscilla B.

description:
I didn't expect much from this small place when I walked in to find I was the only one there, but it blew my mind. 
The food was PHENOMENAL.
The service was AMAZING.
And I just NEED A NAP!! All those delicious flavors exhausted my senses and I am satisfied. Here's to you, lasagna man!
author: Lauren B.

description:
This place is new but very good. 

I wish the prices were just a bit cheaper but it will be a regular place for me. 

The staff was super friendly.
author: Adam Q.

description: THIS PLACE. I can't even describe how delightful the food and service is. I don't even like lasagna. Or I didn't till I came here. The people who make the food here are artists, and they made a lasagna lover out of me. :D
author: Rose K.

description: best lasagna ever! It was really creamy and flavorful. Everything was fresh. The service was amazing - our waiter (Gian Franco) was a total gentleman and was extremely friendly and welcoming. I can't think of a better Italian restaurant in SF
author: renata m.

description: I was doing an event at Dogpatch studios and popped over for lunch.  It was amazing.  Lasagna without the gut bomb requiring an afternoon nap.  Fresh, home made and home grown.  I went back for lunch the next day.  4* only because they weren't open for dinner when I wanted more!
author: David D.

description:
Another spot to eat in the Dogpatch! Keep them coming!
Food is great, sidewalk seating for sunny days, super great service. 
Get in there and check it out so we can keep them in the 'hood!
author: Sarah R.

description: I'm a realtor in SF and Tuesdays are a day of hunting for parking and double parking as I preview properties for my clients. I went to see a property in Dogpatch today and saw a sort-of space that jutted me into a buildings drive-way. I quickly ran I to the corner eatery and asked if I could please semi-block their driveway for a few minutes and I promised I'd come back in to look at their menu. I was fortunate enough to have an extra half hour and sat down and ordered their mushroom lasagna. Man, it was REALLY good, and I'm half Italian!  The thin layers of noodles, the yummy sauce filling but not heavy and just enough. I will be going back. I love lasagna and they have 6 other types. What a nice surprise for me just because I didn't want to piss them off and block their driveway without permission. My tummy is happy.
author: Andrea S.

description: Great spot for lunch with a  great staff. Never let down by the quality of the food or service. Get the lasagna, its filling and will require a 2pm nap but worth it.
author: Mark K.

description: I love the lasagna here! The business is family run and they are extremely friendly. They offer single portions of lasagna as well as whole lasagnas (order 24 hours ahead) that you can take home and finish in your own oven. This is a great option for parties if you need an additional dish and don't have time to cook it. The pesto lasagna is my favorite.
author: Diana G.

description: What a gem! I was in the neighborhood and stopped by for take out. I got 2 orders of lasagna, one with pesto and one with red sauce. Both were amazing. My guess is that you can't go wrong with any of the lasagna options.
author: S Y.

description:
Yum! What a delicious, fun, enjoyable experience. There's nothing quite like this restaurant in San Francisco. Marcella's specializes in a variety of lasagna flavors that are interesting and delicious. Our group tried all four types of vegetarian lasagna available and we were not disappointed. It's so awesome to see a place offer so many veg choices!

The family who owns and operates this restaurant are amazing, generous, and kind. You feel cared for throughout your entire experience! 

The lasagnas are packaged in terrific serving size containers-- so they make great to-go portions.
author: Anisha D.

description: The lasagna is incredible. Probably the best I have ever had. The pasta layers are super thin and the bottom has this crisp texture. I will be back. Love it when you  unexpectedly find a gem of a restaurant. It's very casual, but family run and very friendly.
author: Marissa T.

description: We had a fantastic experience! We stumbled upon this gem and had a great time. Love this father-son business. They are both very funny and passionate about what they make. They are happy to provide you with a warm welcoming environment. His momma's homemade sausage recipe was awesome!
author: Melissa B.

description:
1. Probably the most friendly guy in SF works behind the counter here.
2. I consider the prices reasonable, because there is a hell of a lot of labor involved in making lasagna from scratch.
3. The only reason I'm removing a star is because the slices of bolognese that I purchased had no discernible cheese in them, despite it being listed as an ingredient. Plus, I'm not sure if the super thin pasta is really my style

But I'd be more than happy to give it another shot to reach my final answer.
author: Amanda S.

description: try the black truffle ravioli. I have to go back again and again. Took my husband for lunch there. I just wish they stay open on weekends . Recommend it to all my friends.their sauces are awesome and available at whole-foods in sfo
author: Sayali G.

description: Buy a whole lasagna if you're having a dinner party and I promise everyone will love it. Who is more charming, the father or the son? Whoever serves you, you can't go wrong :)
author: Mrs. E.

description: Wow, amazing. Have heard about this place for a while. Finally made it here before they closed and boy was I not let down. Do not miss out on this melt in your mouth moment. You can literally taste the love that was put into making the food. Can't wait to taste everything on the menu.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Yum!  I ducked into this place because who wouldn't want to visit a "Lasagnaeria".  It was amazing.  Very delicate but hearty lasagna, and the owners are very nice and friendly.  A great neighborhood joint.  The owner's son John even put a couple of cold packs into my to-go order so that the lasagna could keep cool in my car until I would get home several hours later.  Nice place!
author: Vivek A.

description:
This place was a delightful surprise. A very small place with only a few tables inside (and a few outside) and what looks like a deli counter -- but the food!  Wow! 

The lasagna is as good as people say - the noodles are super thin, and in many (six?) layers, so it's not like any lasagna I'd had before.  I ordered the butternut squash lasagna, and it was amazing.  Someone else in my party ordered the mushroom lasagna and it was also good - also multi-layered with those incredible noodles.

The place was described to me as a father-and-son shop, and it really is: the son took our orders and the father made the pasta (among other things) himself and delivered the food to our table!  He was very friendly and told us all about the food, and his philosphy behind food.  Clearly they love what they do, and it shows.

It doesn't look fancy, but it certainly tasted fancy.
author: MIke P.

description: Exceptionally good lasagne! Beautifully crafted, not greasy, perfect. We ordered a piece of the bolognese to-go. They wrapped up a cold piece and gave us instructions on how to reheat. Next time we'll get a couple different types, because it's too good to share one! Another thing we loved was the owner's passion about his lasagne! Great to see small, independently owned spots with a passion for food. Grazie Mille!
author: Sunshine S.

description: Great Lasagna and a wonderful atmosphere. Chef was very friendly. A wonderful experience.
author: William T.

description: First time here and loved it!! Customer service was on point. The lasagna and pasta was simple and delicious as it was all hand made. This spot is no muss or fuss place which is a refreshing break.
author: J L.

description: The best lasagna I have tasted in the city. Makes me hungry just thinking about the next time I can eat there
author: Gary E.

description: Food is delicious! Staff extremely friendly and helpful in every way. I loved the pesto lasagna as well as the sausage lasagna. Totally going to come back when I'm around the area.
author: Stephanie Z.

description: This place has great food AND amazing people making it. Loved the mushroom lasagna and eggplant pizza.
author: Amelia T.

description:
I loathe lasagna, detest it to no end. Know why? Because most people don't know how to make it right, including my mother. Sorry mom!

But this place rocks a great lasagna! Do yourself a favor and go there for homemade deliciousness. Tell them, "Roger sent you."

Do they know me? Nope, nope, and nope, though I definitely say yes, yes, yes to this place.
author: Roger G.

description:
Food speaks for itself. Amazing. You're cheating yourself if you don't try it. 
So impressed with the service. Super friendly, and incredibly accommodating with my large order that couldn't have been convenient for them. My favorite lasagne. Thanks!
author: Nick J.

description: Great lunch spot. Homemade all the way. Tasty & Friendly. I'd come for dinner if they were open later.
author: Aaron T.

description:
We just stumbled into Marcella's yesterday, had never heard of it before.   We were hungry and it was the closest restaurant.  What a happy surprise. 

A caprese salad and order of lasagna were plenty for two of us. 

The salad: anybody can match the greens,they were fresh and good.  The tomatoes:  I can do better in Sacramento from my backyard plants or the farmer's market, but oh, the cheese.  It is real, fresh, buffalo mozzarella flown in from Puglia.  We don't have anything that matches that flavor. It is mild, but the flavor blooms in your mouth and is just different and lovely.  The salad dressing is mild so it doesn't overwhelm the cheese, that great big ball of cheese. Really, it's plenty for two. 

We shared a huge hunk of the  Abruzzo lasagna. My husband likes heartier food and I feared the "sausage" would be big and greasy.  Not so. It is finely ground fresh pork gently spiced with salt and pepper and fennel. The "sausage" mixed with sauce and layered with the impossibly thin pasta was delicious.  It wasn't greasy or heavy, just perfect with a salad.  The flavors are subtle and so balanced.
