Mas and Gianfranco are friendly and happy to talk about their food.  We loved it and will be finding more excuses to go to SF for lunch. We'll  bring a cooler next time to take food home.

This family owned and run place is a gem.
author: Nancy W.

description:
Imagine the stereotypical American lasagna: dense, made with a brick of cheese and chewy noodles. Marcella's does not serve you this awfulness, but instead gives you a deliciously light version, with noodles clearly made from fresh they're so soft. The mushroom and the eggplant lasagnas were both amazing. We ordered a side salad, which they split for us onto separate plates, and it was perfect: balanced, not over dressed, with greens that seemed super fresh.

My friend asked if they had gluten free lasagna. They didn't, but we were told that with 24 hours notice, they could potentially make a whole pan of lasagne that way as long as we committed to buying the whole thing. Seems fair enough, and I think it's pretty cool they're willing to do custom orders like that.

It's a neighborhood, family-run place, and it's a place that deserves lots of support so they can find the firmest of footing. Great service, great food, and a nice spot to sit outside.
author: Anne F.

description: Nice place with friendly staff who love to talk about Italian dishes. Will make it up to you if they cannot serve you a certain dish due to a missing ingredient.
author: Miguel F.

description: Super friendly service and clear pride in their food. Somewhat pricey, but the lasagne is quite good, and their daily specials appeared to be interesting and well received. Definitely a homemade, family owned, authentic feel.
author: Richard L.

description:
Just got the wild mushroom lasagne to go- heated it up for dinner. DELICIOUS! 

Cheesy, perfect comfort food. I'll be back to try some of the other lasagnes.

yum.
author: Nors P.

description: It was our first time here so we tried a little bit of everything. The lasagna and pasta specials were unbelievable!!! The lasagna melted in your mouth! The caprese salad was outstanding! The buffalo mozzarella could not have been any more fresh! Service and hospitality from the owners was a 10 out of 5 stars! I highly recommend!
author: Britt B.

description: Created a Yelp account just to rate this place.Best Lasagna/Hospitality I have ever received. I had found this place one Friday when I was craving Italian while on a business trip in the City. Came across Marcella's so I checked out the reviews and the pictures looked so mouth watering I said to buddy of mine who was here from Ireland lets give this place a shot. Let me start by saying the Abruzzo lasagna is a must try. Filled with spicy Sicilian sausage that was freshly made covered in thick layers of pasta and might I say the cheesiest mozzarella ever also the house salad had a very good vinaigrette that complimented the lasagna very will. John Franco was the gentleman that took care of us and made me feel like I was at home. His service alone is what sealed the deal and from here on will be coming in regularly when I am in the area to eat some lasagna. Thank you for the great service and will be seeing you soon to try out more of the menu.
author: Kevin K.

description: Stopped for an impromptu lunch in SF on the way back to the airport from Napa and stumbled across this place.  It's a small, seemingly family-run business but seemed to be doing pretty good business.  I had the mushroom lasagne (vegetarian) and it was superb!  It's so nice to be able to enjoy a hearty and filling lasagne as a vegetarian!  Hubby had a chicken dish that he enjoyed very much as well.  Service was excellent and prices were reasonable.  Would definitely come back next time in town!
author: Erika C.

description:
I finally understand why Garfield loved lasagna so much. 
I dream of these noodles. DREAM OF THEM.
author: Ambur L.

description: We had their mushroom lasagna and their sausage lasagna; both were phenomenal. The pasta was light and fresh (is it possible to describe pasta as such?) and the flavors were amazing. Terry was so helpful and gracious. We will be back and I wish them much success!
author: Alisha H.

description: Wow, their food is insanely good.  My boyfriend and I just went there, picked up the bolognese and verdura (pesto) lasagna to-go with a caesar salad.  The food is incredible!  Also, the owner and his son who run the place were so warm and friendly.  This is the kind of local spot you really want to do well.  We were hoping the food would be amazing since the owners are so nice and thank goodness it is!  Ultra thin layers of pasta with room for lots of tasty and fresh ingredients.
author: Hilary W.

description: From one Italian to another...this is 5 stars. Hospitality is on point. Food is authentic. Not only do the accents remind me of family dinners, but so do the people. It's got everything it should, plus extra heart.
author: Tiffany C.

description: It's a lasagneria, so you really should order one of their many lasagnas. But if you don't, I can totally vouch for the vegetable panini. Grilled zucchini, mushrooms, fontina cheese, and I can't remember what else. Divine, hit the spot. But it stands alone...no chips in this joint. Nonetheless, I was completely satisfied.
author: Carnley P.

description: Best dining experience in San Fran, and the only Lasagneria in America and possibly the world.  Father-Son team of John Franco and Marcella were incredibly charming, friendly and open to talking about the Father's 50+ years as a gourmet chef all around the world!  The lasagna is made of home-made, very thin-layered pasta and it shows.  Recommend the Mushroom Lasagna; one of the best Italian dishes I've ever had!
author: Etan W.

description: This place has the BEST pasta I've probably ever had. I'd give it a 6 if i could. It's a family run.  The family os awesome.  Don't be scared of good food. And stop in.
author: Ian P.

description: Best lasagna I've ever had.  The lasagna is very thin, making it much less heavy than  any other lasagna I've had over the years.  I've tried three of the sauce types and all were great.  I especially liked the mushroom sauce.  Friendly counter service, with a few tables in/out if you want to eat in.
author: Kevin M.

description:
I live two blocks away, and hadn't managed to sample any of their food until someone brought me a lasagna a few days ago.  I make lasagna, I like to try different recipes, I like eating lasagna at restaurants -- in short, I think lasagna is awesome.  Well, I've now retired from cooking lasagna for myself ever again, because why would I when I could walk two blocks and get a lasagna from these folks. UNBELIEVABLY good.

And on a sidenote, the caesar salad was also great.  Be prepared/advised, though -- the dressing is super-garlicky, which suited my taste but might not be for you.
author: Charmaine Y.

description:
Fantastic. Fresh flavors, light (for pasta) and reasonably priced. Add nice folks on top of that and a sure-fire winner.

Fwiw, take-out order was great by the time it got home.
author: Sa B.

description: Stopped in, met the owners and tried today's special - capellini with a light cream sauce, chicken, mushrooms, parmesan. Excellent! I will definitely be back!
author: Laurie Anne B.

description: Excellent for catering and good lasagna. Very good for office lunch.
author: Davon T.

description: Wow, amazing lasagna! I make the best lasagna and I'm very particular about lasagna I eat at restaurants. Hands down, this was the best lasagna I've had and at the same level of the lasagna I had in Rome. Very friendly father and son owning this little cafe. This is a gem that was just added to the neighborhood. The decor needs a little work but who cares if you are  getting it to go.
author: Nazanin S.

description: The best lasagna ever! I've tried the abruzzo and one of the vegetarian ones so far - they have the perfect balance of meat / vegetables, pasta, sauce, and cheese. The restaurant is small and cozy and the owner and his son are very warm and welcoming.
author: Suruchi K.

description: A much needed addition to the Dogpatch neighborhood.  This is a take-out or eat-by-yourself cafe.  No full service here.  Limited menu.  I recommend sticking to the lasagna.  I tried their minestrone soup.  They advertise organic and healthy.  It was so healthy that it was just bland.  I'll risk a little hypertension.. thank you.
author: Laurence H.

description:
I went here in a rush and asked what was fastest to prepare -- they said the lasagna and it would be ready in 3 minutes.  I ordered it immediately, and yet 30 minutes later, still nothing arrived.  Two tables who had ordered after me already received their food and finished it.  When I got up to leave, the food finally arrived but I left it there because I didn't have time to eat it anymore.  They gave me a full refund, which I appreciated, and I'm pretty sure that this was a one-time screw up, but it made for a terrible experience.  

In all the time I had to sit there and watch the other tables eat, I noticed that the food really looks like it's been microwaved.  It's served in a Stouffer's microwaveable tray -- so it's no wonder they claim it can be ready in three minutes.  If you look back in the kitchen, the place does look legit -- they have lots of chefs in the back preparing what seems to be authentic food. I couldn't help but think that it's as if they hired actors in the back to create the illusion of a legit establishment, but really they are just nuking food.  Kind of like my friend who sells "gourmet artisan cakes" but really uses Betty Crocker cake mixes and icing.  

The tables near me seemed to enjoy the food -- I just didn't get a chance to try it because they were so slow. However, based on the presentation and slow service, I don't think I'll go out of my way to go back.

My advice to them: serve the food on a plate and get it out of that Stouffer's packaging.  And maybe have table-side parmesan cheese that isn't from a Kraft container.

My advice to you: if, like me, you scout out this place and plan to go out of your way to Dogpatch to stop by for a quick bite, you may want to reconsider.
author: Mark D.

description: Though they've just opened, this place has quickly become a staple for my office and my self. The best Italian food in Dogpatch, and the best lasagna in SF.
author: Mike P.

description: Finally found one!!! A great mama & papa italian restaurant with great...and i mean GREAT lasagna. I love shops like this, that aren't super fancy or pretentious..just solid food and great customer service. Among all the fancy, hipster,  michelin star restaurants in the city, this is a place that just makes you feel like your over someones house with amazing home cooking. I got the pesto lasagna, and it was delicious. The pasta wasnt too thick or doughy and the sauce was seasoned perfectly. The best part was the  crunch layer on the bottom....
author: R S.

description: Great lasangas! Carry out or dine in. Fabulous owners -  passionate about eveyrhint they serve and it feels like you're in Italy!
author: Vicki L.

description:
The kitchen in this place is SPARKLING!!!!! DAZZLING! I feel very good eating 
out of Marcellas, no doubts about the quality of ingredients here....
 That wild mushroom lasagna is my favorite & a real crowd pleaser.
Serving this at a dinner party sure removes all stress, we know everyone will love it....
mmmmmmmm!!!!!!!!!!! Yum
author: Lisa C.

description: 10/10. As a lasagna lover I haven't had lasagna this good ever. The thin homemade noodles is probably what makes it so good, but holy shit. Good atmosphere, family owned, friendly service. Absolutely love it. Lasagna is usually a pretty heavy dish but it was really good here and you could pick apart all the flavors and components, instead of eating one cheesy goop of tomato sauce.
author: Jordan L.

description: As many have said, this is the best lasagna I've ever tasted.  Service is friendly and personable.  The only time you should stray from the lasagna is to try the day's special.  Everything is hand-crafted and you can really taste the quality.
author: Andrew H.

description: Wonderful family run Lasagneria.  Great food, splendid people.  I am back here consistently as it is one of my favorite restaurants in the DogPatch.
author: Uri L.

description: Oh. My. God.  This place is fabulous!!  My colleague and I stopped here one day for a late lunch. We wanted something light and fast, and we were in the neighborhood, so we stopped in at Marcella's Lasagneria.  We tried to order salads, but Gianfranco would not hear of it.  We must try the lasagna.  No no, we wanted something light. He assured us that their lasagna was not heavy.  We gave it a shot.  WOW!  This was probably the best lasagna I have ever eaten! It was so light and delicate and had amazing robust flavors.  I had the butternut squash, and tasted my colleague's bolognese lasagna. Both were divine!  I don't know how you can fit 6 layers of pasta and filling into a piece of lasagna that is only 1"  to 1.5" high, but they sure did it.  The layers were very thin, delicate, and delicious.  I ate the whole piece (and part of a second) plus some bread, and felt perfectly sated... not too full (as I had feared). It was the perfect lunch. I immediately started thinking about when I could come back to purchase a whole lasagna for a party, event, or dinner. I'm sure that I will be a regular customer at Marcella's Lasagneria!
author: Sherri H.

description: Love this place! Came here for the first time today for lunch and it is amazing. From the moment we walked in we were greeted and welcomed by the owner, who then passed us on to his soon to help us with our order.  We got the wild mushroom and the pesto lasagna, both amazing. Amazing customer service and really cute mom and pop atmosphere. Portions and price are just right too! Will definitely go back again to try everything else!
author: lina t.

description: I was excited when my coworker found this place by our work. I'm a huge fan of chicken caesars but allergic to the anchovy paste in the dressing. They advertise homemade dressing without the stinky fish. Their salad was delicious. But something happened today that changed all that. As we do a few times a week, I ordered a chicken caesar with extra chicken and my coworker picked it up on her way. The older gentleman at the counter (who I found out to be the owner) not only tried to charge her a considerable amount more than was we are normally charged but was very confrontational about it. By the end of the transaction, I was still charged a $1.50 (ok, I can live with that not a big deal). But when I open the salad box, the extra chicken was absent and I am not paying $14 for mostly lettuce when their reg price chk caesar is $9.75. I walked over hoping this could be resolved easily but was met with disdain by the gentleman who accused me of taking advantage when I explained the situation. He threw his hands up and told me to wait. So I did, patiently. When we came back around I explained that my coworker had just been in here and ordered extra chicken but extra was not in the box. He yelled that he doesn't know what extra means and if I wanted another portion I need to order another salad. I let him know that I come in several times a week and that hadn't been known to me. I've always been charged $3 or so extra and had gotten an extra helping of chicken. He disappeared in the back for a few minutes and then presented me with a few extra bits of chicken. Nothing like what I had gotten in the past. I was tired of arguing and was hungry so I took the salad and left. If you are fortunate enough to encounter the younger gentleman who works here then YAY! He has always been really nice and respectful. This should not have been a big deal. I asked for extra and paid for it. But unfortunately because of the owner I will not return. He was very rude and is in dire need of customer service skills. They have however earned free advertising. It's a shame. I really liked this place.
author: Katharine R.

description: I'm not only a huge fan of Marcella's family owned business but I'm a fan of lasagna now.  They are so incredibly inviting and personable as they heat up and wrap your lasagna to go.  I wish I would have stayed to eat there just so I could chat more.
author: around town e.

description: The food here is fabulous! I just ate Tuesday's lasagna bolognese and they are not skimpy on the portions. I ate the whole thing! The pasta layers are the perfect texture and the meat was perfectly distributed. They also have a daily vegetarian option and they all look fantastic!
author: Gina M.

description: I absolutely love this spot! Everything about it! I treat myself once a week to their AMAZING caprese salad! In between my weekly lunch I crave the mozzarella! This charming family owned and ran business has been around Dogpatch for years and it a hidden gem! The vibe of the restaurant is really casual but perfect for lunch meeting. The black truffle ravioli is to die for as well!!
author: Michelle c.

description:
We were exploring Dogpatch looking for a lunch spot and were thinking about Hard Knox when we found a parking space across from a "lasagneria"? Could it be? A place that specializes in lasagna? Yes!
Four or five different variations made fresh each day! I could go on and on Bout how friendly the family/staff are bit that's been covered by everyone else in other reviews. I could talk Bout the fact that the place is tiny and maybe you will need to wait for a table of its busy ( we had no wait) but what you go to a lasagneria for is the lasagna? Right? Well my wife ordered the bologna se, made with ground sirloin. Light, creamy, delish. Easily the best lasagna we have had  in a long time, maybe ever! I however was struck by the daily special. Fettuccini with pancetta, spinach, king mushrooms in a white wine, garlic, grape tomato sauce. It was very good, the pasta was perfectly cooked al dente and the sauce was great. However next time I think lasagna it will be, as my wife's was amazing! I too wish they were open later for dinner. We will be back!
author: Gary G.

description: Oh the lasagne, noodles so thin like a baklava, spread with a full flavored tomato-mushroom umami sauce.i closed my eyes and i thought i was in rome. The proscuitto/buffala mozzarella pizza of the day was a topping to die for, very generous portions of both spendy items. My one not love was the pizza crust. I ordered a lasagne for a work party later this week and look forward to trying the  butternut squash version.  A woman was enjoying the pesto/zucchini lasagne as best she could, her partner seemed very interested in hers after devouring his own. Peeps in the hood are definitely flocking to this lunch spot, the tables outside were consistently full and menus hard to find. The family that owns marcella's is serving authentic, homestyle italian , a rareity in the patch, and is willing to adapt orders to personal tastes. The owner happily displayed and explained the quality products he uses and you can taste the superiority. Do try marcella's, we are lucky to have this passion for food in our neighborhood.
author: Kelly K.

description: I've had better lasagne, it's called Stoffeurs, you can get it at most major supermarkets.  I only write this review because I got food poisoning from it too.
author: sara l.

description: Wow, I just noticed them tucked around the corner off 22nd - off 3rd. I am completely satisfied with the special bowtie pasta with mushrooms & cream sauce. Perfection. I'll be back.
author: Paul F.

description: Simply delicious. Even tasted great after a stint in the microwave! Love the homemade noodles
author: Tony O.

description: Catering menu is amazing.  You can order sheet pans of lasagna either hot to eat right away or room temp to heat up later.  I've ordered both ways and equally fantastic.  People keep saying it's different - because it is! The homemade thin pasta sheets and sauces are so, so, so, so, good. Light, delectable.  Instant party with one or two of their salads. Grilled vegetables delicious and pea mint salad unusual and tasty complement to the lasagnas.  All the flavors of lasagna are outstanding.  Hard to pick a favorite, but probably the Bolognese.  Last time I picked up a couple of the aoli spreads - basil and the truffle. Wow. Run don't walk to this place!
author: Melinda L.

description: This place rocks!!  Absolutely the best lasagna.  We (three people) went through an entire tray of meat lasagna in two nights.  Can't wait to get more!!
author: Olivia P.

description: So nice to have another alternative in the area for lunch.  I work in the area, and places here have been limited.  Marcella's is a family run place that uses fresh ingredients and makes everything from scratch.  Went there today for the first time and had a panini and soup.  Very filling, and a great price.  Everyone is super friendly and helpful.  Highly recommended.  Also nice to bypass the big lines at Just for You, and walk in here and get a seat!
author: Valerie F.

description: so far super awesome.  between the super friendly people (i'm not sure but they were pushing a family-run vibe) working there and the really yummy food...i'm really stoked to have them in the neighborhood.  i'm enjoying the sweet pepper lasagna and the minestrone as we speak and they're both really, really yummy.  the sauce on the lasagna is so good.  the portions are pretty big.  welcome to the dogpatch!
author: Emily T.

description: Fabulous Lasagna!  Fresh quality ingredients!  Owner/Chef is very passionate about what he is doing and it shows in his food.  Try it!
author: Nancy F.

description: I love this place! The staff is friendly and they've been making the best lasagna for years now. It's my favorite little spot to get good Italian in the Dogpatch.
author: Joseph M.
